title: Associate Market Manager
description:
Associate Market Manager

Job Number:

 3257306


POSTING DATE: Sep 12, 2024
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
EDUCATION LEVEL: Refer to Position Description
JOB: Wealth Management
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Executive Director

DESCRIPTION


POSITION SUMMARY:

  


The Associate Market Manager plays a key role in the overall management of all aspects of the Market. Job functions include retaining employees, managing risk, driving revenue growth, increasing profitability, maintaining a superior and consistent level of client service, developing cohesive teams, and providing consistent leadership. The Associate Market Manager helps in ensuring proper fiscal management, personnel management and morale, and business ethics and practices, as well as compliance with all Federal, State, and Local laws and regulations. In addition, it is expected that individuals successful in this role will be goal-oriented and interested in pursuing future Branch or other management positions. The Associate Market Manager reports directly to the Market Executive.

  


DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES:  


Leadership:
* Leads by example by maintaining a positive morale, a track record of personal growth or reputation for growth, has ethical business practices, and demonstrates a commitment to diversity and respect for others
* Leads proactively by identifying trends, potential areas of growth and weakness and addressing these areas in order to positively position the Market within the geographic area


* Leverages the resources of the Firm to achieve the highest level of success
* Plays a key role in leading Market’s efforts of sales and growth

  


Team Building:
* Plays a role in building an effective team across the Market by communicating relevant information on a timely basis and conducting meetings on behalf of the Market Executive
* Participates in Market and Region initiatives, including sales, hiring, recruitment, diversity, and community outreach
* Plays a key role in growing the Market through hiring, lateral recruiting and training

  


Product/Business Knowledge:
* Has a thorough understanding of the Firm’s products and those of its strategic partners; uses this knowledge to provide resources and direction to drive sales
* Possesses a good understanding of the Firm’s resources; able to direct the sales force to the right resources in an efficient manner as to make the sales process more efficient
* Has the ability to effectively apply product/business knowledge to recruiting efforts

  


Accountability:
* Plays a leading role in the Market’s financial and sales performance, including expense management
* Assists in regulatory, legal and compliance issues including: Risk management for the Market in regards to monitoring sales, human resources, and legal and regulatory practices
* Assists in the creation and administration of an Annual Supervisory Plan for the Market
* Contributes to establishing a core compliance model in offices under supervision

Sales/Marketing:
* Seeks opportunities to grow business and drive sales by capitalizing on Firm initiatives
* Assists Market Executive in driving corporate marketing initiatives to help increase market share in High Net Worth households

QUALIFICATIONS



Education and/or Experience:
* At least 4 or more years of experience as a Financial Advisor (with satisfactory production and compliance record), or comparable product area or management experience
* Bachelor’s Degree required

  


Licenses and Registrations:
* Active Series 7, 8 (or 9 and 10), 66 (or 63 and 65) and 3 registrations (Series 31 acceptable if Branch conducts managed futures business only)
* Other licenses as required for role or by management

  


Skills:
* Effective written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to think critically
* Ability to manage a team
* Strong attention to detail
* Ability to interact with senior management team, Financial Advisors, support staff, clients and corporate and field personnel as needed
* Ability to own projects at a Market level
* Ability to organize and prioritize work, meet deadlines, and complete projects

  



Reports to:
* Dual reporting into the Market Executive and the Regional Chief Operating Officer


* All candidates should verify that they meet the minimum eligibility requirements prior to applying.

  


Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $150,000 and $160,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs.  


Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees.  



It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, sex stereotype, gender, gender identity or expression, transgender, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy, veteran or military service status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  



Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/Disability/Vet).

title: Vice President, Wealth Management - Regulatory Change Management Program PMO
description:
Vice President, Wealth Management - Regulatory Change Management Program PMO
Job Number:

 3258854


POSTING DATE: Sep 12, 2024
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-Purchase
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree
JOB: Wealth Management
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Vice President

DESCRIPTION


Morgan Stanley Wealth Management is seeking a dynamic and organized Vice President to join our Regulatory Change Management Program (RCMP) team. The goal of the RCMP is to coordinate across various functional areas (Product/Platform/Segments/ Legal/Risk/Compliance/Tech/Operations) to deliver required solutions in a way that integrates the User and Client Experience with the Regulatory directive

A successful candidate will be responsible for facilitating the strategic analysis, design, development, and execution of changes to ensure compliance with a broad inventory of regulations across a wide array of Products and Platforms. This role will have ongoing interaction with internal colleagues ranging from the daily execution teams through the senior leadership of each functional area.  


Key Responsibilities:  

* Help manage the Regulatory Change Management process, ensuring alignment with business objectives and compliance requirements.
* Coordinate with stakeholders to assess regulatory impacts and develop change management strategies.
* Develop comprehensive project plans, including scope, goals, deliverables, resources, and timelines. On certain projects the overall team will work closely with additional project support staff from the Business Transformation Services (BTS) team, on other projects this role will serve that function directly
* Assist in conducting risk assessments and implement mitigation plans to address potential challenges.
* Prepare and present project status reports, updates, and dashboards to senior management and other stakeholders.
* Ensure clear communication and documentation of regulatory changes and their impact on business processes.
* Foster a culture of continuous improvement by identifying opportunities to streamline processes and enhance efficiency.
* Provide leadership and guidance to project teams, promoting collaboration and best practices.
  


QUALIFICATIONS


Qualifications:  

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Operations, Technology or a related field.
* Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in project management, regulatory change management, or a similar role within the financial services industry.
* Knowledge of wealth management and regulatory environments.
* Proven track record of managing complex projects and driving successful outcomes.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written; ability to produce concise and effective presentations tailored to technical and non-technical audiences.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to multitask and prioritize.
* Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines.
* Flexible and self-motivated
* Proficiency in MS Office with advanced skills in PowerPoint and Excel.


Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $85,000 and $135,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs.

Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees. description:
WM Platforms Analyst

 3258675

To be successful in this role, the candidate must be a self-starter capable of solving complex problems, have the ability to multi-task across a variety of projects and processes, be a succinct and accurate communicator, and be attentive to details, while understanding the broader strategy.

title: Registered Nurse (Ambulatory) - Days- No Weekends+5k SOB - Jamaica Estates
description:
Base Salary + Sign On Bonus (SOB)

AdvantageCare Physicians (ACPNY) is a primary and specialty care practice serving half a million patients across the New York metropolitan area. With more than 35 medical offices across New York City and Long Island, ACPNY is continually expanding our practice and enhancing our services for communities throughout New York. As we grow, our employees grow with us.

**The ideal candidate should have**

· Work experience as a Nurse in a hospital or ambulatory setting

· Patient-centered approach toward a positive patient experience

· Excellent communication skills

· Interest in Population Health

**Responsibilities**

Our Registered Nurses organizes and provides clinical supervision to the patient care team including, but not limited to, delegation of responsibilities, mentoring, evaluating, educating, scheduling and counseling the care team staff. Our Registered Nurses are responsible for providing professional nursing care to patients and proactively supports the efforts to ensure that standards for patient satisfaction, patient safety, and quality of care are maintained, as established by AdvantageCare Physicians. This role functions as one of the primary liaisons between patients, staff and physicians and supports the Advanced Care Model.

**Qualifications**

* Graduate of an accredited school of nursing
* Current, unrestricted, licensure in the State of New York as a Registered Nurse
* Knowledge of professional nursing theory, regulations and practices to give and evaluate patient care
* Knowledge or Electronic Medical Records (EMR)
* Ability to work independently within scope of practice, make appropriate clinical decisions and delegate appropriately
* Basic Life Support (BLS) required

**Medical Office Hours of Operation**

· Monday-Thursday 8:00AM – 6:00PM

· Friday 8:00AM – 5:00PM

**Why work at AdvantageCare Physicians?**

ACPNY’s vision is to become a home for health that provides personal, effective, and convenient care for the neighborhoods and communities we serve. When our teams of providers, nurses, and specialists work together, we can get patients in sooner, answer their questions in real time, and give them the support they need to achieve their health goals. Everything we do is guided by our values:

Empower — We believe in acting as proactive self-starters and enabling our colleagues to succeed.

Deliver — We believe in achieving our goals and taking accountability for our actions.

Do It Together — We believe in caring for our customers, patients, and one another, while valuing diversity, equity, and inclusion.

Encouraging growth and development is an important part of the employee experience at ACPNY. We empower employees to develop both personally and professionally through a variety of programs, including internal collaborative learning opportunities where team members share stories from their own lives, discuss research, and ultimately learn from each other.

We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to creating a strong workplace and community.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $95,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Internal Medicine

Physical Setting:

* Clinic
* Community health center
* Outpatient

Experience:

* primary care: 1 year (Preferred)
* Nursing: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* BLS Certification (Required)
* NY State RN License (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Content Marketing Associate
description:
**Company Description** **Salary range:** $60-65K

**Find a job that lets your imagination run wild!**


WildBrain is made up of a team of innovators and creators who bring industry-leading kids’ content and brands to families globally. We inspire imagination, put creativity first, and believe in the power of storytelling. We are constantly connecting the powers of our global team, making WildBrain a collaborative, openminded and passionate environment to work in.


To work at WildBrain means you get to create stories that let imaginations run wild. Join our team today to become part of the story!

The Content Marketing Associate supports the Peanuts Worldwide global marketing and licensing efforts by driving organic social media strategy, maintaining a deep understanding of all Peanuts content (including classic specials, Apple TV+ shows and specials, and custom content), and managing promotional content opportunities. The Content Marketing Specialist may also lead marketing partnerships, as assigned.

 **Job Description**  

* Drive Peanuts’ organic social strategy, collaborating with Digital Marketing Manager on brand campaigns
	+ Prepare and manage weekly social media calendar
	+ Program and post graphics and videos to channels
	+ Work with Domestic and International teams to support licensees through social media, while maintaining good balance of “pure” and promotional content
	+ Manage social media approvals for licensees
* Support marketing partnerships with asset development, including activity sheets, graphics, toolkits, etc
* Serve as point on 3rd party partnerships as assigned
* Support the Marketing and Licensing Teams by maintaining up-to-date knowledge of Peanuts animated content, as well as legal restrictions
* Track Apple content usage for licensees, ensuring it remains under legal limits
* Manage clip license requests for promotional usage and cut clips for licensees as needed
* Provide support and technical direction on Peanuts-led custom content (e.g. Take Care shorts, caption voice records, etc)
* Support the Marketing & Communications team on major marketing tentpoles

  

**Qualifications**  

* Progressive experience within a content marketing role
* Proficient experience across the Microsoft suite of products
* Proficient in Adobe suite (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects)
* Experienced in Final Cut Pro
* Hands on experience managing social media: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, TikTok, and Analytics

 **Additional Information** **Hybrid work**


Employees work in a hybrid model balancing collaboration in our office and remote work.

**What We Offer**


Working at WildBrain is more than a job — it’s the opportunity to join forces with extraordinary, insightful and imaginative people who will recognize your talents and encourage your professional growth and development in a work environment that promotes creativity and individuality. Some of the perks we have are private medical insurance, income protection, gym subsidy, bonus time off, employee share programmes, reduced summer hours and flexible & home working.

**Our Commitment**


Diversity and Inclusion are in our DNA. As a global leader in kids and family entertainment, we strive to reflect and honour the diversity of our audiences around the world. We believe that creating diverse and inclusive content & brands begins with fostering a culture of belonging at WildBrain. To us, a culture of belonging is one where we celebrate and welcome the diversity of all employees, stakeholders, and external partners and strive to create an environment where every individual feels valued, respected, and brings their authentic self to work.


We demonstrate our commitment to this by striving to provide a supportive work environment and a corporate culture that welcomes and encourages equal opportunities for all employees. **We recognize that people bring experience and talent that goes beyond the technical skills and requirements of a job. If you possess similar experience that is close to what we’ve listed here, we encourage you to please still consider applying. We strongly believe that diverse experience, transferable skills, and passion are key!** WildBrain accommodates people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process. Applicants are encouraged to make their needs known in advance if accommodation is required.

**About WildBrain**


At WildBrain we make great content for kids and families. With approximately 13,000 half-hours of filmed entertainment in our library – one of the world’s most extensive – we are home to such brands as *Peanuts, Teletubbies, Strawberry Shortcake, Caillou, Inspector Gadget, Johnny Test* and *Degrassi*. Our shows are seen in more than 150 countries on over 500 telecasters and streaming platforms. WildBrain’s portfolio spans all areas of the entertainment industry: WildBrain Studios, where we develop and produce hit animated and live actions series; WildBrain Television, which is composed of prominent kids’ television channels in Canada (Family Channel, Family CHRGD, Family Jr. and Télémagino); home to Peanuts Worldwide; brand management to some of the world’s most-loved kids brands; celebrated global licensing and distribution teams with WildBrain CPLG, and a leading children’s YouTube network in WildBrain Spark, one of the largest networks of kids’ channels on YouTube, with over 168 million subscribers.


WildBrain is headquartered in Canada with offices worldwide and trades on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: WILD). Visit wildbrain.com to learn more!

 **About WildBrain: a parent company of Peanuts Worldwide**


At WildBrain we inspire imaginations through the wonder of storytelling. As a leader in 360° IP management, we are experts in content creation, audience engagement and global licensing, cultivating and growing love for our own and partner brands with kids and families around the world. With approximately 13,000 half-hours of filmed entertainment in our library—one of the world’s most extensive—we are home to such treasured franchises as Peanuts, Teletubbies, Strawberry Shortcake, Yo Gabba Gabba!, Caillou, Inspector Gadget and Degrassi. WildBrain’s mission is to create exceptional entertainment experiences that captivate and delight fans both young and young at heart.


Our studios produce such award-winning series as The Snoopy Show; Snoopy in Space; Strawberry Shortcake: Berry in the Big City; Sonic Prime; Chip and Potato; Teletubbies Let's Go! and many more. Enjoyed in more than 150 countries on over 500 platforms, our content is everywhere kids and families view entertainment, including YouTube, where our network has garnered over 1 trillion minutes of watch time. Our television group owns and operates some of Canada’s most-viewed family entertainment channels. WildBrain CPLG, our leading consumer-products and location-based entertainment agency, represents our owned and partner properties in every major territory worldwide.


WildBrain is headquartered in Canada with offices worldwide and trades on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: WILD). Visit us at wildbrain.com.

title: Personal Injury Paralegal - Jr. Underwriter - 3 years of PI Experience
description:
**The Role**

Do you love working on new cases but don't enjoy drafting pleadings? Then this position may be a great opportunity and the right fit for you! As a junior underwriter paralegal, you will work directly with our Underwriting Attorneys & Sales Director to maintain our current client relationships as well as providing intake and underwriting support.

In addition, you will be responsible for participating in the day-to-day operations of processes related to Pegasus’s legal and medical funding services to constantly improve our services for our clients.

The position will provide opportunities to grow within.

**Key areas of responsibilities will include:**

* Providing Intake for prospective clients
* Reviewing case files, entering case information; writing up case synopses (liability/damages/insurance, etc.).
* Establish and foster client relationships within law firms and medical practices
* Perform effectively working independently, in small teams, and communicating with colleagues and clients in different locations, geographies, and time-zones

**Requirements/Skills:**

* Please do not apply if you do not have enough Personal Injury Law experience
* **3+ years of litigation experience in a plaintiff personal injury law firm**
* Diligent, detail oriented, intuitive, good at taking direction, not afraid to ask questions, able to learn quick, ability to see the BIG picture and take initiative.
* Strong communication skills – written, phone, in person
* Professional and presentable
* Ability to thrive in a start-up environment

**So what’s in it for me?**

* A collaborative culture encouraging professional growth and development
* Medical Benefits, Dental, Vision, 401k, Life, 15 days of PTO and bank holidays
* Very supportive, team oriented environment
* Fast growing (50-100% per year) with opportunity to rapidly advance as the company grows
* Fast paced technologically

· Salary: $58k-68k (based on experience)

Monday - Friday 10am-6pm

**About Us:**

Pegasus Legal Capital is the leading and fastest growing legal funding company in the Northeast. We have just recently opened a South Florida location in Deerfield Beach and are looking for new motivated individuals to join our team.

We provide monetary advances for plaintiff’s and their family's needs and medical procedures.

Our founders used their decades of finance experience to develop a fast and efficient funding process that is the best in the industry. Our staff is trained to gather all necessary information from attorneys and case managers and guide plaintiffs through our few simple steps to funding with grace and respect.

Pegasus Legal Capital markets business-to-business via online, trade shows and thru in-person sales calls. Our business is driven by referrals, which are driven by reputation and relationships. Our reputation in the industry is second to none. We seek to build and grow relationships with attorneys and healthcare providers to encourage them to refer their clients to us. Attorneys appreciate our in-depth understanding of case values and plaintiffs appreciate our reasonable pricing. Healthcare providers appreciate our ability to let them treat more clients and to get paid quickly as well as our reasonable pricing.

Pegasus is an incredibly fast growing company needing to bring on new members to join our team. The Pegasus work culture is all of the following: centered on our core values, provides upward career opportunities, is very team oriented, fun and dynamic. We mean it seriously when we say that we want all of our new team members to be additive to our culture.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $58,000.00 - $68,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Personal injury law: 3 years (Required)
* Litigation: 3 years (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Ronkonkoma, NY 11779 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Bio Med Tech (Anesthesiology)
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


NYC Health + Hospitals/Jacobi is a 457-bed teaching hospital affiliated with the Albert Einstein College of Medicine. The facility has earned numerous Center of Excellence designations, accreditation, and recognition for its renowned Level 1 Trauma Center, Burn Center, Surgical Intensive Care Unit, regional Stroke Center, Snakebite Treatment Center, Breast Health Center, Bariatric Surgery Center, and Cancer Service. The facility also offers the region’s only multi-person hyperbaric chamber, allowing up to nine patients to dive together at one time. Jacobi’s Ambulatory Care Pavilion is a stunning complement to its inpatient acute care, allowing staff to provide patients with high-quality service in a modern, state-of-the-art environment.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


Check us out online:


www.nychealthandhospitals.org


careers.nychhc.org


Docs4nyc.org

  


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


Purpose of Position:


Under medical direction, performs work of more than ordinary difficulty and responsibility in the operation and monitoring of bio-medical machines, devices, equipment or instruments in a hospital, clinic or other medical facility. Assists as a member of a medical research or clinical team. May supervise operation of one or more units; performs related work

* Set up the OR room before each case
* Prepare and clean medical equipment after each case
* Stock and refill all anesthesia carts, including drugs and supplies
* Stock and refill all anesthesia carts, including drugs and supplies
* Maintain inventory and supplies for OB suites and family planning suite
* Replace and check laryngal blades
* Assist technician at NCBH if necessary

  


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. Associate Degree, which included courses in the bio-medical technician field, and two years experience in the appropriate bio-medical technician field in an approved hospital or health facility; or,


2. Senior high school graduation or possession of an Equivalency Diploma, and three years experience in the appropriate bio-medical technician field in an approved hospital or health facility; or,


3. A satisfactory equivalent combination of education and experience.


4. Employees performing blood analysis require certificates of qualification issued by the New York City Department of Health in subspecialty of 29 (Ph blood gases) or specialty 28 (general clinical chemistry).


**Department Preferences**
--------------------------

  


Tour 7:00am-3:00pm


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button or forward your resume, noting the above Job ID #, to:  

  

http://employment.nychhc.org


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs
company_description: We always put patients first! NYCHHC is committed to excellence in health care and the safety of people in the City of New York.

title: Assistant Bio-Medical Equipment Technician
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


NYC Health + Hospitals/Bellevue is America’s oldest public hospital, established in 1736. Affiliated with the NYU School of Medicine, the 844-bed hospital is a major referral center for highly complex cases, with its 6,000 employees including highly skilled, interdisciplinary clinical staff. It sees more than 110,000 emergency room visits and 500,000 outpatient visits annually. Bellevue is an academic medical institution of international renown. We have served as an incubator for major innovations in public health, medical science, and medical education. Bellevue is a Level I Trauma Center delivering around-the-clock care in adult, pediatric, psychiatric and pediatric psychiatric emergencies as well as in the nationally-designated categories of cardiology, neurology, toxicology, and neonatology. In addition to providing comprehensive inpatient and outpatient state-of-the-art care Bellevue is a city-wide medical specialty referral source. Bellevue’s clinical centers of excellence include: Emergency Medicine and Trauma Care; Cardiovascular Services; Designated Regional Perinatal Center and Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (ICU); Comprehensive Children’s Psychiatric Emergency Program; and Cancer Services.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


Periodic checking of OR anesthesia monitors, (EKG, pressure monitors, pulse oximeters, etc.) and recording their status to insure proper functioning. Daily checking, cleaning, and maintenance of anesthesia machines located in the OR, OB suites or other areas


Checking functionality of all sophisticated anesthesia equipment including but not limited to anesthesia machines, Sonosite ultrasound device, transcranial Doppler, Transesophageal echo device, transcranial 02 monitor and obtain help from Sr. Technologists in correcting malfunctions if necessary


Stocking of Anesthesia carts in teh OR, OB Suite or other areas


Helping Manager and monitoring technologist organize anesthesia equipment and supply, receiving and relaying messages, coming to the equipment room etc.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. Satisfactory completion of one year's service as Bio-Medical Technician Trainee; or,  

2. Associate Degree which included a course in the appropriate medical technician field at the second year level; or,  

3. One academic year of study in an accelerated junior college, college or university which included six semester hours in the health or medical field and/or chemistry or biological sciences, plus a nine-month approved training course in appropriate medical machine technician field; or,  

4. Successful completion of an approved program in Operating Room or Surgical Technician, plus two years experience in appropriate medical technician field; or,  

5. A satisfactory equivalent combination of education and experience.  

6. Employees performing blood analysis require certificates of qualification issued by the New York City Department of Health in the subspecialty of 29 (pH blood gases) or specialty 28 (general clinical chemistry).


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans

* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities

NYC Health + Hospitals/Bellevue is America’s oldest public hospital, established in 1736. Bellevue is a Level I Trauma Center delivering around-the-clock care in adult, pediatric, psychiatric and pediatric psychiatric emergencies as well as in the nationally-designated categories of cardiology, neurology, toxicology, and neonatology. In addition to providing comprehensive inpatient and outpatient state-of-the-art care Bellevue is a city-wide medical specialty referral source. Bellevue’s clinical centers of excellence include: Emergency Medicine and Trauma Care; Cardiovascular Services; Designated Regional Perinatal Center and Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (ICU); Comprehensive Children’s Psychiatric Emergency Program; and Cancer Services.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


Periodic checking of OR anesthesia monitors, (EKG, pressure monitors, pulse oximeters, etc.) and recording their status to insure proper functioning. Daily checking, cleaning, and maintenance of anesthesia machines located in the OR, OB suites or other areas


Checking functionality of all sophisticated anesthesia equipment including but not limited to anesthesia machines, Sonosite ultrasound device, transcranial Doppler, Transesophageal echo device, transcranial 02 monitor and obtain help from Sr. Technologists in correcting malfunctions if necessary


Stocking of Anesthesia carts in teh OR, OB Suite or other areas

4. Employees performing blood analysis require certificates of qualification issued by the New York City Department of Health in subspecialty of 29 (Ph blood gases) or specialty 28 (general clinical chemistry).  

  

Note: Effective January 1, 2015, employees performing central service functions, while serving in the Group 12 title of Bio-Medical Equipment Technician (215620), must either possess valid certification as a Certified Registered Central Service Technician (CRCST) issued by the International Association of Healthcare Central Service Material Management or as a Certified Sterile Processing and Distribution Technician (CSPDT) issued by the Certifying Board for Sterile Processing and Distribution, or be grandfathered. Grandfathering requires that employees provide evidence that they have been employed in a healthcare facility for a cumulative period of one (1) year occurring between January 1, 2011 and December 31, 2014 and that they have competently performed central service functions during the course of their qualifying experience and will continue to be able to competently perform such functions during the course of their employment at HHC. In addition, these employees will be required to annually complete ten (10) hours of continuing education credits in order to remain qualified to perform central service functions at an HHC facility.

title: Operations Manager
description:
**Job Title:** Operations Manager for a Beauty & Wellness company

**Location:** New York, NY

**Company Overview:**

sundays is a non-toxic nail care brand focused on wellness.

Going to the salon is about so much more than just getting your nails done — it’s a small, but powerful way to practice self-care for your mind and body.

sundays studios are designed to feel like home so that clients can feel comfortable and be themselves, without the hustle and bustle of rushing. We are a community — our incredible employees, beautiful clients, and social followers that are passionate about wellness and have joined us in their own way, on this journey.

As a leader in our field, we are seeking a results-driven and strategic Business Development Manager to join our high-performing team.

**Job Summary:**

As a Retail Operations Manager, you will oversee the execution of tactics and initiatives that support company strategy and continuous retail excellence. You will collaborate cross-functionally to test, improve, and optimize applications and system enhancements to improve the customer and employee experience. You would lead the planning, development, refinement and execution of retail initiatives that support company strategy and collaborate with internal and cross functional partners to identify and plan solutions for operational excellence opportunities.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Compliance and SOPs:** Develop, implement, and monitor compliance programs to ensure all operations align with legal and regulatory requirements.Regularly review and update SOPs to reflect changes in regulations and business practices.
* **Studio Operations:** Manage and streamline the operations across multiple salon locations, ensuring consistency in service quality and customer satisfaction, as well as salon **compliance**.
* **Inventory Management:** Oversee inventory levels, including ordering, stocking, and managing supplies to ensure salons are well-equipped without overstocking.
* **Budgeting:** Develop and manage budgets for each location, monitor expenses, and monitor financial performance, analyze variances, and implement strategies to increase profitability.
* **B2B and D2C Operations & Logistics:** Coordinate with suppliers, partners, and direct-to-consumer channels to ensure efficient logistics and supply chain management.
* **Customer Service Excellence:** Implement strategies to enhance customer satisfaction and retention & address customer service issues and implement corrective actions.
* **Team Leadership:** Lead and support the salon managers and staff to meet operational goals, providing training and development opportunities where necessary. Conduct performance reviews, provide constructive feedback.
* **Strategic Planning:** Collaborate with the management team to align operational strategies with overall business goals. Identify opportunities for expansion or improvement.
* **Marketing and Promotions:**Coordinate with the marketing team to promote salon services and special offers. Analyze the effectiveness of promotional campaigns and adjust strategies accordingly.

**Qualifications:**

* 4-6 years of operations experience, and 2+ years of stores / field leadership.
* Logistics: Familiar with fulfillment centers, packing requirements, shipping and processing for products and all the backend work of logistics and ordering products for back stock.
* College degree
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Strong ability to successfully interface with all levels and areas of the organization, establish close working relationships, and support for improvement opportunities.
* Can identify operational improvement opportunities and work with others to generate and implement solutions.
* Ability to work a flexible schedule to meet the needs of the business; may require weekends and evenings.
* Very organized and good with tracking their processes and reducing costs and creating more efficient processes.

**Benefits:**

We offer PTOs, Health Benefits and a fun and friendly team environment.

If you are a motivated and strategic sales professional looking to make a significant impact in a growing company, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us in shaping the future of sundays!

title: Faculty / Department Chair
description:
New York University: NYU - NY: College of Dentistry: General Dentistry and Comprehensive Care
### **Location**

New York, NY
### **Open Date**

Sep 10, 2024
### **Description**

The Department of General Dentistry & Comprehensive Care at the New York University (NYU) Dentistry seeks applications for a full-time tenure/tenure track faculty member and department chairperson.



NYU Dentistry, one of the most dynamic and robust dental educational and research institutions of higher education in the world, seeks a visionary leader and proven administrator as Chairperson of the Department of General Dentistry & Comprehensive Care. Leading a talented and diverse group of students, faculty and staff, the chairperson will provide the overall vision for the department and will be accountable to fulfill its educational, clinical, research and service missions.



The chairperson will have oversight of the department’s pre-doctoral DDS programs, both didactically and clinically. In this role the chairperson will promote excellence in teaching and ensure a high quality of education in the DDS program that accords with contemporary standards in general dentistry education. The chairperson must also be a productive scholar with a demonstrated ability to secure extramural funding to support research and program development initiatives within the department.



The chairperson will also have responsibility for the overall administration of the department and will work collaboratively with the dean to expand and improve services to best meet our community’s dental health needs. Administrative duties include faculty recruitment, retention, and development; oversite of organizational structures and collaborations; budget management; and participation in accreditation processes to ensure alignment with Commission on Dental Accreditation standards.



The Department of General Dentistry & Comprehensive Care provides a respectful, equitable, diverse and inclusive community that fosters creativity, innovation and collaboration. The successful candidate will be encouraged to build collaborative linkages to other science, engineering, and medical programs at NYU through affiliated positions in other departments. NYU is committed to building a culturally diverse and inclusive intellectual community, and strongly encourages women and minorities to apply.



Why join the NYU Faculty? https://www.nyu.edu/about/careers-at-nyu/faculty-and-researchers/why-join-the-nyu-faculty.html



NYU offers an excellent benefits package with opportunities to participate in its faculty practice in the heart of Manhattan. Salary and academic rank are commensurate with credentials and experience.


*In compliance with NYC’s Pay Transparency Act, the annual base salary range for the rank of Associate Professor is $135K - $225K & for the rank of Professor is $165K - $265K. The position will provide additional compensation for serving as Chair of the Department. New York University considers factors such as (but not limited to) scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate’s work experience, education/training, key skills, internal peer equity, as well as market and organizational considerations when extending an offer.*

  



### **Qualifications**

Qualified candidates must possess a DDS/DMD degree from a Commission on Dental Accreditation accredited program or equivalent international dental degree and be licensed or licensure-eligible in the State of New York. Candidates should possess a documented history of significant academic accomplishments in teaching and scholarly activity. Tenured or tenure eligible. Demonstrated evidence of funded research, publications and presentations are preferred. Candidates at the associate professor or professor level will be expected to demonstrate a record of research accomplishments including extramural funding.



A history of leadership and administrative experience within a complex organization is requisite. At least five years of administrative and leadership experience in an academic setting is required. Candidates should also demonstrate a record of success in mentoring, developing faculty, and supporting faculty in academic and teaching endeavors.



Candidates must be sensitive to the needs of and possess an interest in working in an academic community that is diverse with regard to race, ethnicity, religion, nationality, sexual orientation or identity, disability status, age, and protected veteran status.

  



### **Application Instructions**

Candidates should send curriculum vitae, statement of academic objectives, names and addresses of four references to: Dr. Brian L. Schmidt, NYU Dentistry via Interfolio by clicking the "apply now" button. The search will continue until an appropriate candidate has been selected.

title: Intake Specialist
description:
At Gillman Capone Law, we pride ourselves on delivering exceptional bankruptcy services with a personal touch. Our team is dedicated to providing top-notch support and advocacy to our clients. We’re seeking a motivated and dynamic Intake Paralegal with a strong sales background to join our growing team and help us continue to achieve excellence.

As an Intake Specialist with a sales background, you will play a crucial role in managing client intake processes and converting potential clients into retained bankruptcy matters. Your unique blend of empathetic communication and sales acumen will help streamline client onboarding, enhance client satisfaction, and contribute to the overall success of our firm.

- Client Intake: Conduct initial consultations with potential clients, gather and analyze case information, and assess the viability of cases using firm procedures and CRM.

- Sales Integration: Leverage your sales experience to effectively communicate our firm’s services, address client needs, and close new client engagements.

- Documentation: Prepare and maintain detailed case files, including client intake forms, sourcing, locations, and detailed data to rely upon for informed decision making on advertising and support spend.

- Client Communication: Serve as a primary point of contact for clients throughout the intake process, providing exceptional customer service and addressing any concerns.

- Follow-Up: Implement follow-up strategies to ensure client satisfaction and address any additional needs or questions.

title: Asphalt Utility Laborer - Haverstraw, NY
description:
Job ID: 501938

  

Safety, Integrity, Quality are the foundation or core values on which Tilcon New York Inc., a CRH company operates. Located in New York and New Jersey, Tilcon New York Inc. is an integrated materials company with multiple quarry locations, water terminals, heavy highway construction division, asphalt and recycle plants. Tilcon manufactures sells and ships, made in the USA, products of crushed stone, asphalt, sand, gravel and recycled materials throughout New York, New Jersey, and some areas of Pennsylvania. Growth opportunity, professional development and a culture of support and resources are provided to each employee for their personal growth and success within Tilcon New York Inc., and CRH.

 **Position Overview**


Ensure safe, efficient and proper operation of feed conveyors, hoppers, chutes.

 **Compensation**

**Starting Rate** $29.50+


Shift differentials, holiday pay, PTO, safety apparel allowance, paid health benefits, 401k plan, company contributed pension plan, annuity plan, and savings plan, and more!

### **Roles & Responsibilities**

### **(Essential Duties and Functions)**

* Inspect work area and complete Work Area Inspection forms and Production report daily.
* May be called upon at discretion of the Plant Manager to perform any other duties assigned and to assist other departments if necessary.
* Perform routine maintenance.
* Assist in repairs and maintain housekeeping.
* Wear a hardhat, safety glasses, steel-toed footwear, gloves, hearing protection and respirator as needed.
* Learn and implement OSHA standards and regulations to insure a safe operating environment is maintained at all times. Report any safety concerns to the Plant Manager immediately.
* Regular and timely attendance is required.

### **Qualifications**

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.

  



**Education/Experience**


Required

* High School or GED
* Successful completion of MSHA/OSHA Training
* Task training on an as needed basis

  

Preferred:

* Welding and Cuttings skills useful.
* Knowledge of asphalt production preferred.

  

Knowledge/Skill Requirements

* Basic mechanical skills needed.
* Must possess the ability to properly splice and maintain conveyor belts.
* Must be able to identify areas of containment.
* Ability to carry out simple oral and written instructions.
* Basic mathematical skills
* Able to perform all duties without a direct threat of injury to the individual or others.
* Ability to operate assigned equipment safely and efficiently.
* Demonstrates safe, productive job performance.
* Ability to communicate effectively with and work well with other personnel.
* Ability to carry out simple oral and written instructions and deal with simple problems.
* Ability to read English or Spanish.

 **Physical Requirements**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 **Frequently**


* Bend
* Kneel
* Squat
* Stand
* Walk
* Reach
* Fine motor

  



**Occasionally**

* Sit
* Drive
* Repetitive motion
* Right
* Left

  



**This position requires an employee to lift:**

 **Frequently**

* 0-10 lbs.
* 10 -25 lbs.

 **Occasionally**

* 25-50 lbs.

 **Work Environment**


The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  

The noise level in the work environment is usually loud.

 **Continuous**

* Exposed to noise
* Moving equipment
* Works with others

 **Frequently**

* Hot weather
* Cold weather
* Wet weather

 **Occasionally**

* Exposed to high heat

  



**What CRH Offers You**

  

* Highly competitive base pay
* Comprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programs
* Group retirement savings program
* Health and wellness programs
* A culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion

 **About CRH**

  

CRH has a long and proud heritage. We are a collection of hundreds of family businesses, regional companies and large enterprises that together form the CRH family. CRH operates in a decentralized, diversified structure that allows you to work in a small company environment while having the career opportunities of large international organization.

  

If you’re up for a rewarding challenge, we invite you to take the first step and apply today! Once you click apply now, you will be brought to our official employment application. Please complete your online profile and it will be sent to the hiring manager. Our system allows you to view and track your status 24 hours a day. Thank you for your interest!

  



Tilcon New York Inc., a CRH Company, is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Patient Care Associate
description:
Job Description



Assists patients with activities of daily living, provides basic nursing care, and performs a variety of procedures, exams and tests. Assists in maintenance of a safe and clean environment, and promotes improved customer relations.



Job Responsibility





* Functions as a key member of the nursing care team participating in the implementation of the patient's plan of care.Promotes improved customer relations with patients and their families


* Makes recommendations for improved patient care and the promotion and maintenance of a safe, cost-effective health-care environment.Assists the nurse in providing for all ADL (activities of daily living) needs of patients


* Communicates and documents patient status.Assists the nurse and other health team members by performing a variety of procedures, exams, tests, treatments and clerical duties as required by the unit


* Communicates and documents all pertinent data.Maintains non-patient and patient care units in a neat and orderly condition; strips patient units upon discharge and prepares rooms for new admissions; maintains necessary stock on all procedure and supply carts; and ensures that all equipment is clean and in its appropriate place.Transports/accompanies patients to various departments, as directed; performs post-mortem care and transports body to morgue.Utilizes proper isolation techniques and established safety, waste disposal and infection control procedures at all times


* Follows Medical Center's policies and procedures supporting quality assurance efforts in-patient care services.Participates in various continuing education programs, surveys, and attends staff meetings, as directed.Accesses medication delivery and/or medication areas, as authorized, in the performance of required duties, as needed.Performs related duties, as required.



* ADA Essential Functions



Qualifcations:


* High School Diploma or equivalent, required. Successful completion of a NYS Certified Nursing Attendant program, or completion of one year clinical course work actively pursuing RN degreeAND Must pass Lenox Hill Hospital Patient Care Associate's competency test prior to entering training program, required.Must pass Lenox Hill Hospital training program within the normal probationary period, required.Heart Saver Certification, preferred.Demonstrated competency in at least one of the following; EKG testing or venipuncture procedure, preferred.Ability to communicate effectively and follow written and/or oral instructions. Demonstrated competency in basic mathematics.Ability to operate all medical equipment necessary to perform job duties.Ability to lift, turn, position, move and restrain patients as required.

The salary range and/or hourly rate listed is a good faith determination of potential base compensation that may be offered to a successful applicant for this position at the time of this job advertisement and may be modified in the future.When determining a team member's base salary and/or rate, several factors may be considered as applicable (e.g., location, specialty, service line, years of relevant experience, education, credentials, negotiated contracts, budget and internal equity).

title: Patient Safety Associate (HH Nurse Assistant Training Program)
description:
Job Description



Under direction and supervision of Registered Nurse, provides patient supervision, maintains safety of patient and completes observation flow sheets.



Job Responsibility





* Functions as a co-worker to the nurse and a key member of the nursing care team, and provides patient supervision and communicates changes in patient condition to the nurse in change.
* Documents accurately on Constant Observation flow sheet.
* Interacts with patients, visitors and staff to support patient’s specific needs related to age, culture, spiritual, physical, and mental challenges.
* Provides for a safe environment for patient safety.
* Maintains safety of patient by requesting assistance from others for personal care needs of patient.
* Accompanies patients to other departments.
* Maintains patient environment that is free of clutter and potential hazards.
* Reports defective equipment and unsafe conditions.
* Follows policy for Constant Observation at all times.
* Performs related duties as required. All responsibilities noted here are considered essential functions of the job under the Americans with Disabilities Act. Duties not mentioned here, but considered related are not essential functions.

title: Food Service Worker
description:
Job Description



Performs one or a number of tasks relating to the preparation and service of food; the delivery and collection of food and supplies, the appropriate operation of machinery, and the sanitation of specific areas of the department.



Job Responsibility





+ Prepares and serves food to patients as assigned.
+ Prepares and arranges food according to guidelines or tallies.
+ Handles food in accordance with sanitary regulations.
+ Serves food while accurately filling requests.
+ Transports food and supplies to designated areas within the Hospital or cafeteria.
+ Delivers food trays, nourishment, supplemental feedings and supplies in an orderly and timely fashion.
+ Collects used carts or trays and returns them to the kitchen.
+ Maintains a sufficient amount of each item to support needs.
+ Operates machines used in the preparation of food or sanitation equipment and work area.
+ Uses machines/equipment in a safe and efficient manner.
+ Operates all utensils according to proper procedures.
+ Maintains cleanliness of the work area.
+ Mops floors, cleans equipment, utensils, work and service areas, using detergents and germicides required.
+ Refrigerates and labels perishable food.
+ Stores all supplies in an orderly fashion.
+ Sorts all silverware for washing and cleans, polishes stainless steel equipment.
+ May perform environmental service duties.

* Performs related duties as required.


* ADA Essential Functions

* High School Degree or equivalent, required.
* Prior institutional experience, preferred.
* Ability to communicate effectively. Must be able to understand and follow verbal instructions. Must be able to communicate in English.

title: Catering Associate- Per Diem
description:
Job Description



Performs activities supporting preparation and service of food, delivery and collection of food and supplies, operation of machinery, and department sanitation.



Job Responsibility





+ Stocks workstations and mobile cares with service ware, condiments and perishable and non-perishable food items prior to each meal service period.
+ Cleans and replenishes carafes for hot beverage service for each meal service period.
+ Rotates and checks expiration dates of all food items according to department policies and procedures.
+ Identifies patients by name and date of birth at each interaction per hospital and regulatory guidelines.
+ Distributes printed menu and diet information cards to patients prior to first meal service.
+ Assists patient with menu selections. Communicates if requested items are inconsistent with diet order and makes recommendations for appropriate alternatives.
+ Obtains patient menu selections, assesses and modifies selections for therapeutic appropriateness per Nutrition Care Order, as needed.
+ Communicates with nursing staff to identify any changes in Nutrition Care Order prior to meal service period. Communicates any concerns regarding patient meal service to appropriate clinical staff member
+ Tallies hot and cold food items and communicates needs to production staff within established timeframe prior to scheduled assembly.
+ Assembles tray in designated area according to daily assignment sheet, Nutrition Care Order and patient menu selections.
+ Performs catering rounds after delivering meal trays at each meal service.
+ Distributes and collects patient trays. Delivers late trays / rush trays to units, as needed.
+ Notifies management of any issues during meal service including, but not limited to, shortages, unacceptable quality, and substitutions.
+ Informs Dietitian of any patient related issues including, but not limited to poor food intake, diet order discrepancies, and food allergy concerns.
+ Cleans pantry according to established guidelines. Follows proper procedures for cleaning and sanitizing kitchen equipment/ surfaces.
+ Ensures proper storage of all food items, with proper labeling / dating. Discards expired products.
+ Removes waste from plates and service ware. Stacks washable items for dishwasher and operates dishwasher according to department guidelines.
+ Delivers clean service ware to designated areas.
+ Delivers floor stock and nourishments to patient floors. Completes floor stock/nourishment record forms for each unit daily. Deliver snacks directly to patient at designated times.
+ Returns census/diet list, snack list, floor stock record forms and supplement lists to designated location.
+ Collects and returns all food, condiment, and mobile food carts to kitchen after each meal service period.
+ Maintains safe and sanitary environment by cleaning up spills and using appropriate safety signage. Immediately notifies management of any unsafe conditions.
+ Cleans and sanitizes mobile food trucks, workstations counters/shelves, refrigerators, wire racks, etc and uses cleaning chemicals according to established policies and procedures. Notifies management of any chemicals not properly labeled.
+ Answers department telephone in a professional and courteous manner.
+ Records telephone requests in appropriate log and processes requests for meal trays, special request items and/or Nutrition Care Order changes. Delivers items within established timeframe.
+ Generate and file reports, as assigned.

* Performs related duties as required.


* ADA Essential Functions


* Walking, standing, bending, pushing and pulling of trucks.
* Lifting of supplies 20 lbs or less.


Job Qualification





* High School Diploma or equivalent, required.
* Prior related food and/or dietary work experience, preferred.
* Ability to communicate effectively in English (verbally and in writing).

  

  

* **Additional Salary Detail**


The salary range and/or hourly rate listed is a good faith determination of potential base compensation that may be offered to a successful applicant for this position at the time of this job advertisement and may be modified in the future.When determining a team member's base salary and/or rate, several factors may be considered as applicable (e.g., location, specialty, service line, years of relevant experience, education, credentials, negotiated contracts, budget and internal equity).

title: Let's Chat Technology - Looking for Experienced Professionals in NY & Alpharetta
description:
Let's Chat Technology - Looking for Experienced Professionals in NY & Alpharetta

Job Number:

 3258951


POSTING DATE: Sep 12, 2024
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Vice President

DESCRIPTION


Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries. As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.  

  

Technology works as a strategic partner with Morgan Stanley business units and the world's leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global, complex, and dynamic financial markets. Morgan Stanley's sizeable investment in technology results in quantitative trading systems, cutting-edge modelling and simulation software, comprehensive risk and security systems, and robust client-relationship capabilities, plus the worldwide infrastructure that forms the backbone of these systems and tools. Our insights, our applications and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients' businesses and to our own.  


Besides a competitive salary, work life balance, a clear career path, and great benefits, we take the well-being and work satisfaction of our employees seriously. That’s why we put a lot of effort towards creating a safe space for people to be vulnerable, share work, and ask questions that will help them both to grow individually and move their projects forward. You’ll be encouraged to bring your own perspective to conversations, and we will help you understand and put into practice what you naturally do best by amplifying each other’s strengths.  


QUALIFICATIONS


REGISTER YOUR INTEREST FOR THE FOLLOWING ROLES:  



Developer: Our development teams design, develop and maintain applications used by our business units. Daily activities include meeting with clients to gather and analyze requirements. They make system design decisions, evaluating, integrating and developing necessary software, and then test and deploy applications to production. Developing high-performing, low-latency electronic trading systems, and evolving complex workflows and life-cycle management capabilities are just some of the projects available for developers. For Developer roles, we look for experience in development of applications in one or more object-oriented languages: Java, C++, C#/.NET, Python, Full Stack, Web Developer.  


Engineer: Our engineer’s provide tools, applications, and platforms which are the foundation of our cutting-edge systems. Engineers work on the Firm’s networks, computing hardware, operating systems and databases. They provide the foundation we need for the Firm’s cutting-edge, critical systems including trading applications, mobile applications and other end-user applications. Engineering the Firm’s websites, managing the Windows plant and developing a client reporting delivery system are some of the projects available for engineers in our organization. We also offer Production-facing roles where you will be responsible for ensuring the stability of our systems and infrastructure. Some of our engineering roles include Security Architect Engineer, Systems Engineer, Database Engineer, Reliability & Production Engineer / Site Reliability Engineer, Workspace Solutions, Help Desk. Technical skills that may be relevant to the type of engineering role may include infrastructure knowledge in Linux / Unix or Windows, experience of networking protocols, experience in scripting languages such as Python, database administration / development experience including SQL queries.  


Cloud - Software Engineer: The Cloud Product team is part of Cloud team within the Cyber, Data, Risk and Resilience organization. The mission of Product is to safely enable the Firm’s data, infrastructure, and systems in off-premises environments. This includes teams that define strategy and architecture, manage product lifecycle and features, and build applications and services to secure the Firm’s journey to the cloud. The successful candidate will be an individual contributor with a background in software engineering and an interest in building large-scale, cutting-edge systems to solve complex problems in the cloud. The Cloud Product team sets the vision and strategy for Morgan Stanley’s use of cloud products and services. The team translates that strategy into a product roadmap and backlog and builds software to deliver capabilities that enable new business and reduce risk to the Firm. We’re seeking talent with hands-on experience with at least one major public cloud provider, software development knowledge such as Java, Python, Golang, or Rust as well as knowledge of SQL, NoSQL, and distributed databases and experience with automation and CI/CD tools and practices.  



Technical Business Analyst: A part of an Agile Squad analyzing processes, applications, and tools, defining requirements and data logic, and supporting execution of projects to deployment. The analysis will include, but not be limited to gap analysis, system analysis, and impact analysis. They will proactively contribute to changes in data infrastructure and flows, and act as experts in their area. Skills we look for in this role involve being data driven, the ability to write queries to perform adequate analysis on data for requirements, familiarity with Agile Processes, Ceremonies, and Structure as the support Data Ingestion squads, and with using JIRA or equivalent software to document and track user stories.  



Scrum Master/Project Manager: A dynamic and technologically advanced team where a Scrum Masters embodies the core values, being client focused, leading with excellence, do the right thing, and being team oriented. The candidate brings knowledge of Agile principles and ceremonies, experiences in collaboration across complex organizations, removing impediments, and ensuring team progress towards their missions and deliverables. Ideal skills we look for include program and project management experience while working across functional teams, experience with Technology projects related to Financial Services domain, knowledge of Wealth Management, Banking technology & related applications, familiarity with Agile – scrum methodology preferred, program management tools, including Microsoft Project, Access, Word, Excel, Visio, and SharePoint.  


Cyber: Join our Cyber team and help us protect our critical systems and assets. You will be part of a team of security professionals dedicated to keeping our systems secure. You must have an in-depth knowledge of security practices and technologies, as well as the ability to develop and implement security solutions. We are looking for someone who is passionate about technology, security, and has the drive and enthusiasm to keep our systems safe. Skills for this role include knowledge of security practices and technologies, including encryption, authentication, and identity management, working knowledge of security tools, protocols, and vulnerability scanners, familiarity with networking and network security, ability to analyze, develop and implement security solutions, scripting (Python, BASH, Perl, or PowerShell), coding, or other development experience.

  



Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees.

It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, sex stereotype, gender, gender identity or expression, transgender, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy, veteran or military service status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/Disability/Vet).  



Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $150,000 and $205,000 per year at the commencement of employment. title: US Banks Governance & Framework
description:
US Banks Governance & Framework

Job Number:

 3258846


POSTING DATE: Sep 12, 2024
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree
JOB: Other
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Executive Director

DESCRIPTION


Background on the Position  

The role will reside within Legal and Compliance Division - Operational Risk. Operational Risk refers to the risk of financial or other loss, or potential damage to a firm's reputation, resulting from inadequate or failed internal processes, people, systems, or from external events. The Firm may incur operational risk across the full scope of its business activities, including revenue-generating activities (e.g., sales and trading) and control groups (e.g., information technology and trade processing). This position directly supports a senior-level team in operational risk by providing analytical, decision-making, and presentation support.  

  

The successful candidate will lead the Bank Framework and Governance team to execute on the Global Operational Risk Framework activities, lead execution of programs and be a trusted advisor to the 1LOD Bank's Operational Risk First Line of Defense (1LoD) team. The role will involve building relationships and close coordination with line managers and risk experts in business lines and the bank.  

  

Primary Responsibilities  

> Manage the Bank's Operational Risk Framework, in coordination with the Global Operational Risk Framework team and the Bank's Enterprise Risk Management team, to drive a consistent approach on execution and risk management  

> Serve as the primary representative for Bank's Operational Risk Team with Bank Enterprise Risk Management and Enterprise Non-Financial Risk and coordinate monthly and quarterly framework activities (e.g., risk appetite assessments, concentration risk, Top Operational Risk assessments, risk governance framework assessments)  

> Lead core budgeting, resource planning and strategy for Bank's operational risk including updates to organizational charts, coordination with Firm and Bank budget teams, and execution of annual planning activities  

> Create reporting and dashboards to support the monitoring and reporting of operational risk incidents, issue management and metrics  

> Manage the US Banks Operational Risk metrics inventory including periodic refreshes and threshold breaches, and provide input and guidance to the Bank's coverage and specialized teams  

> Develop and maintain US Bank Operational Risk policies and procedures  

> Define and execute on the Bank's stress testing program including risk identification and stress testing; Lead the quarterly operational risk capital production and sign-off and work with Bank finance on the capital planning process including recovery and resolution and capital planning actions  

> Define and update the Bank's Operational Risk Appetite and identify tolerance statements, as appropriate; define measurements in concert with the Bank's Risk Appetite Framework  

> Lead the governance materials for Bank Operational Risk Oversight Committee, Bank Risk Committee and Bank Board Risk Committee  

> Lead coordination of coverage for Internal Audit, Regulatory Exams, and Compliance Assessments (Laws, Rules, Regulations - LRR) for US Banks ORD  

> Execute on Compliance Laws, Rules and Regulations assessment for US Banks Operational Risk  

> Lead the development and execution of the annual operational risk management plan, requires tracking deliverables, monitoring and oversight, and reporting to relevant senior management and committees  

> Leverage existing Firm and Department Reporting to maintain and update Operational Risk Reporting to the various Bank and Firm Risk and Governance Committees

QUALIFICATIONS


Experience Required:  

> Bachelor's degree required, ideally in a quantitative discipline, Risk, Finance, Economics or similar  

> 10+ years of work experience in Operational Risk/Enterprise Risk Management roles within a Retail or Private Banking environment  

> Confidence to take ideas forward and to challenge others, where appropriate  

> Proven ability to identify opportunities to enhance and streamline internal US Banks ORD processes  

> Strong understanding of banking regulation, especially relating to operational risk management,  

> Strong organizational skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize; ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines, detailed oriented  

> Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written; ability to produce concise and effective presentations  

> Effective interpersonal skills, freely develops networks, builds consensus, prioritizes effectively, and develops alliances across an organization  

> Ability to work in a small team environment, building and maintain a network of contacts and coordinating with a large number of stakeholders  

  

Experience Preferred:  

> Internal experience in the Firm's financial and operational control infrastructure

Expected base pay rates for the role in New York will be between $165,000 and $275,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs.
