title: Central Service Technician L II (REVISED)
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Woodhull Medical and Mental Health Center is attuned to the healthcare issues that matter to the people of North Brooklyn. Woodhull focuses on preventing disease and promoting healthy lifestyles by reaching out to the community at various locations.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Work Shifts**
---------------

  


**12:00 A.M – 8:00 A.M**

  

**Job Description**
-------------------

  


**PURPOSE OF POSITION:**


Central sterile is the area in the hospital where cleaning and sterilization of devices used in medical procedures takes place, therefore the purpose of this position is to be able to sterilize medical equipment and instruments and prepare the supplies for use in procedures and surgeries.

**AREAS OF RESPONSBILITIES:**


Decontamination, Prep and Pack, Rolling stock, Sterilization

**SUMMARY OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Perform and participate in the decontamination, cleaning, processing, and sterilization of instruments and equipment.
* Practice infection control, asepsis techniques and isolation procedures in accordance with departmental policy and procedures.
* Perform High Level Disinfection with Cidex OPA Solution making sure the Quality Assurance Tests are completed first and always donning protective equipment
* Collect soiled instruments from various clinics and departments; operate machines such as washer/sterilizer, steam sterilizer, ultrasonic, Automatic Endoscopic Reprocessor and sterrard sterilizers to clean, reprocess High Level Disinfect and sterilize instruments for re-use such as Flexible Fiberscopes, Transvaginal Probes, TEE Probes, Manometer Probes, Bougies, etc. according to manufacturer's IFU.
* Assemble surgical and treatment sets and trays as prescribed by procedure.
* The above items reflect the primary general duties of the principal function of the job.
* They are not to be considered a detailed job description of all work requirements that may be inherent to the position.
* The job description may be changed as needed.

  


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


For Appointment to Level I:  

1. Documented designation of Grandfathered status as a Central Service Technician.  

  

For Appointment to Level II:  

1. Hold and maintain a Certified Registered Central Service Technician credential issued by the Healthcare Sterile Processing Association (HSPA); or  

2. Hold and maintain a Certified Sterile Processing and Distribution Technician credential issued by the Certifying Board for Sterile Processing and Distribution (CBSPD).  

  

Note: Effective January 1, 2015, all newly hired incumbents to the title of Central Service Technician must hold and maintain a Certified Registered Central Service Technician credential or a Certified Sterile Processing and Distribution Technician credential and be assigned at Level II. In addition, any employee who functions as a Central Service Technician will be required to annually complete ten (10) hours of continuing education credits in order to remain qualified to perform the functions of a Central Service Technician at an NYC Health + Hospitals facility.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


**Please be advised that proof of Covid-19 vaccination is required prior to hire.**


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:


* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

title: Consumer Advocate - Transitional & Supportive Housing
description:
**Division/Department:** Transitional & Supportive Housing /Third Street Women’s Residence


**Work Schedule:** Regular, Full Time. Sunday to Wednesday 9am-5pm and Thursday 1pm-9pm


**Pay Type:** Salary


**Organizational Overview:**  

Henry Street Settlement opens doors of opportunity to enrich lives and expand human progress for Lower East Side residents and other New Yorkers through social services, arts, and health care programs. Building on its 125+year legacy of innovation and effective programming, Henry Street offers more than 50 programs and is one of New York City’s largest social service agencies.


**Program Overview**:



The Transitional and Supportive Housing Cluster is a $9.1M division which provides Transitional Housing and Supportive Housing to Homeless individuals and Families, victims of Domestic Violence and Formerly Homeless Individuals. Services include four shelters; two family shelters, a domestic violence shelter, a shelter for Single Women with Mental Health Issue as well as a NYNY Supportive Housing building for formerly homeless individuals with Mental Health issues.



The Third Street Women’s Residence is a critical part of this network, providing transitional shelter and supportive services to 79 homeless women with mental illness concerns who are in need of permanent housing. The staff provides an array of social and housing placement services, working with the residents to enhance and develop life management skills, as well as to manage their mental health conditions. When needed, residents are referred to community-based organizations.


**Job Summary:**

The Consumer Advocate role is within the Third Street Women’s Residence which is a 79 bed shelter for homeless women with Mental Health issues. This program includes on-site psychiatric and nursing services to supplement case management and housing services.


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelors required; Masters of Social Work (MSW) preferred
* Minimum of three (3) years of experience working with indigent and or homeless population
* Strong Case Management, organizational, problem solving skills, and Housing Specialist skills
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Knowledge of computers such as Microsoft office, outlook, etc.
* Bilingual (English/Spanish) preferred
* Must be able to travel throughout the five boroughs to service population in the field. Ability to be flexible with arrival and departures times due to travel time.


**Responsibilities:**


* Formulate service plans and goals and assist residents to access and maintain permanent housing
* Work intensely with clients by escorting them on apartment searches
* Work with all Case Managers/ Housing Specialist to assist clients with reaching and maintaining independence goals
* Prepare clients for independent housing and conduct apartment search activities
* Ensure placement into appropriate housing
* Establish and develop new linkages with real estate brokers and landlords; maintain an active roster of real estate brokers and landlords
* Assist individuals seeking apartments in the public and private sector
* Accompany residents to appointments including: public assistance, apartment viewing, interviews, lease signing, and furniture shopping when necessary
* Provide aftercare follow up services for clients once they move into permanent housing, including home visits and phone follow up for up to one year
* Link clients to social services in new communities to enhance acclimation and stability
* Prepare all required reports and documents required by funders
* Perform all other tasks deemed necessary at the direction of the Assistant Program Director to aide in the shelter’s achieving its programmatic goals
* Coordinate responsibilities with Social Service Team in order to assist residents with housing, documentation, medical, obtaining benefits, identification etc.
* Ensure rules and regulations are communicated to the residents
* Submitting weekly calendar and monthly reports
* Assist case managers/housing specialist with collecting compiling data and documentations
* Participate in weekly case conferences
* Other related duties as assigned by supervisor


**Essential Physical Job Functions:**


* Ability to lift up to 30 pounds
* Ability to climb stairs (up to six flights)

#### **Education**


Required* Bachelor Degree or better

title: Case Manager, Abstinence Program
description:
**Title:** Bilingual Case Manager, Abstinence Program
  
**Program:** In Homes Now- Abstinence Program
  
**Salary Range:** $48,000 -$55,000
  
  

**Program Description:**  

In Homes Now is a Scatter Site Housing Program. The Abstinence Program provides housing to clients in recovery who are leaving the shelter system and have histories of homelessness, substance use, and mental health. The Abstinence Program presently houses 85 clients in Brooklyn, The Bronx, and Manhattan. The multidisciplinary team includes case managers, peer counselors, psychiatric care providers, and occupational therapy interns who work with clients to ensure housing stability and improve wellbeing.
  
  

**Overall Responsibilities:**  

This is a full-time position at PRI. The case manager will be responsible for managing a caseload of 28-30 clients. The case manager will be responsible for meeting with the clients a minimum of two times per month. This position requires field work.
  
  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**  

The essential duties of the Bilingual Case Manager, Abstinence Program include but are not limited to the following activities:
  
* Conduct monthly home visits to resident apartments
* Conduct monthly office visits
* Conduct annual housing inspections
* Counsel clients about various issues such as money management, sobriety, and employment and other goals
* Facilitate caseload groups
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date clinical documentation and file for caseload
* Complete initial and annual assessments
* Complete quarterly service plans
* Provide referrals to community providers to ensure that clients are linked to providers in their neighborhood


**Qualifications:**  

* BA preferred. Associates Degree will be considered with relevant experience
* Must be bilingual in Spanish
* A minimum of two years in the human service field
* Experience working with individuals who are homeless and/or those affected by substance abuse preferred
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Strong time management skills


All newly hired Project Renewal staff must provide verification of being fully vaccinated against Covid-19.

title: Child Care Workers
description:
Participates as necessary in admission of new residents.

Maintains an awareness of each resident's emotional, physical, and spiritual needs and refers him/her to other team members (when necessary) to meet these needs.

Be alert that each adolescent is prepared for and attends his programmed appointments: psychological, psychiatric, educational, and medical.

Provides immediate intervention utilizing therapeutic crisis intervention techniques to de-escalate potentially volatile situations.

As a member of the treatment team contributes to the formulation of a treatment plan for each individual in the unit through submission of written reports and participation in discussion. Carries out treatment plan where appropriate.

Organizes recreational activities that would make leisure time a positive, rewarding experience.

Sees to the daily care and cleanliness of the living facilities.

Sees to overall management of clothing, household supplies and equipment.

Provide transportation - if approved as Agency Authorized Driver, will transport Residents as requested.

Supervises the resident's personal hygiene routines.

Remain alert to be available for "active" listening to any adolescent in unit in line with that adolescent's treatment goals.

Completes daily log, and other reports as requested and submits same to appropriate staff.

Follows proper procedures for reporting damage or needs in the physical plant, supplies that are needed etc.

Advances professional development by participation in the facility's in-services training program: bi-monthly supervision and by attending outside conferences, seminars and workshops as requested by his/her supervisor.

Promotes and fosters in residents positive values such as: integrity, dignity, self-control, poise, honesty, self-respect; a sense of personal responsibility; motivation for study, careers and goals in life; appropriate spiritual and religious attitudes in accordance with each resident's religion; respect for personal property, equipment etc., as well as the appropriate use of money.

title: Director of Training and Employee Engagement (Assistant Personnel Director), HR Administration/Bellevue
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**


NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


Under general direction, with considerable latitude for independent judgment and initiative, develops, plans and establishes training, educational and developmental programs in order to enhance skills, remedy deficiencies, upgrade human resources and meet forecasted skill requirements of the facility. Manages and administers the day-to-day activities of the training and engagement section including planning, supervision, coordination, control and direction of the training and engagement section/group. Additionally, will plan, organize, and coordinate programs, and develop and implement initiatives within the Human Resources Department, as well as the facility as a whole, to support employee wellness, retention and engagement.

**General tasks and responsibilities will include:**

* Conduct seminars, workshops, and conferences for managerial and executive staff.
* Deliver general or specialized training sessions covering areas like orientation, on-the-job training, leadership, and more.
* Design, develop, and deliver training courses aligned with organizational goals.
* Managing external management and professional development programs for senior management.
* Establish and implement administrative systems for participant selection and course evaluation.
* Conceptualizes training programs based on needs assessments to improve employee performance.
* Develop follow-up systems to track and ensure training effectiveness.
* Conduct research on training best practices and trends.
* Work with Department Heads to prepare training curricula to address specific skill gaps.
* Provide support for employee engagement and wellness program planning.
* Assist with strategic planning and project implementation.
* Evaluates the success of training programs in the management and development continuum and redesigns programs based on these evaluations.
* Oversees the collection and evaluation of data to determine effectiveness of engagement and wellness initiative, and to support the decision-making process for future programming.
* Plans, coordinates and implements wellness programs and other facility and/or departmental projects that strengthen organizational resources to achieve strategic goals, including staff engagement, retention and improved employee well-being.
* Leads the outreach for the development of new wellness initiatives and plans and coordinates the marketing efforts to promote upcoming programs.
* Conducts needs assessments to identify gaps in wellness program offerings and availability, and identifies ways to create equity in program delivery across disciplines, units and tours.
* Performs other tasks and duties as assigned.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. A Master's Degree with specialization in Personnel Management, Business Administration, Labor Relations, Psychology or Vocational Guidance, and two years of experience in personnel management or personnel administration in a large governmental agency, hospital or healthcare facility or civic organization or business firm employing at least three-hundred employees, one year of which must have been in a responsible administrative or supervisory capacity; or,  

2. A Baccalaureate Degree issued from an accredited college or university, and three years of experience as indicated in (1), two years of which shall have been in a responsible administrative or supervisory capacity. (Experience which consists solely of the maintenance of personnel transactions will not be accepted); or,  

3. A satisfactory equivalent combination of education and experience.


**Department Preferences**
--------------------------



* 5 years of experience
* Extensive knowledge of the principals of training and manpower development programs and ability to analyze and determine the needs of the facility
* Employee engagement and training programs in a health care facility,
* Business or educational, governmental organizations or other fields relating to training, development and program planning
* An equivalent combination of education, training, and experience indicating the ability to perform satisfactorily
* Demonstrated skills in oral communication and the ability to relate to others;
* Proficient writing and research skills;
* Event planning


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

*If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.*


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

title: Migrant Resource Navigator, Team Supervisor(s)
description:
### **Migrant Resource Navigator, Team Supervisor(s)**


**About NYDIS:**  

New York Disaster Interfaith Services (NYDIS) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit faith-based federation, uniting faith communities, human services providers, and charitable organizations to deliver disaster readiness, response, and recovery services in New York City and Puerto Rico – and, when requested and capable, metro NYC counties.


**Position Overview:**  

NYDIS is seeking a full-time Resource Navigator Supervisor to oversee a team of Resource Navigators serving asylum-seekers and eligible populations at municipal Reticketing Centers. The Supervisor will play a critical role in ensuring that clients are effectively connected to health, human, and social services. This position will mentor, train and manage a team of Resource Navigators, ensuring service delivery standards are met, issues are escalated appropriately, and all compliance and reporting requirements are fulfilled. This is a 12-24 month contract position with the possibility of extension, expected to serve approximately 1,400 clients per week. The Supervisor will report to the Resource Navigation Manager.


**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Manage an onsite Resource Navigator Teams staffing that module at NYC’s Reticketing Center.
* Train and supervise, the day-to-day operations of Resource Navigator Team shifts, ensuring staffing levels are maintained and that teams are effectively meeting the needs of eligible individuals
* Act as the onsite Point of Contact for NYC’s Reticketing Center management. Ensure control and processes follow any escalation for complex client cases or challenges that arise in the Reticketing Centers.
* Train new Resource Navigators in cultural and religious literacy and competency, program protocols, community resources, data entry procedures and resource referral tracking systems.
* Ensure accurate and timely data entry and resource referrals.
* Regularly review data input to ensure compliance with organizational standards and contractual obligations.
* Collaborate with the Resource Navigation Manager to compile reports on service delivery, client trends, and emerging issues. Ensure that all staff comply with reporting requirements and documentation guidelines.
* Provide leadership and coordination in disaster or crisis situations, ensuring the safe, rapid and efficient response of the Resource Navigator team to those settings.
* Foster a culturally and language competent team that offers a welcoming and supportive client experience for asylum seekers and migrants from diverse backgrounds and circumstances.
* Provide trauma informed care and referrals that meet any emergency needs
* Full-time work hours are available Monday-Saturday, flex and weekend hours are available.

**Qualifications:**  

* Master’s degree in social work, human services, public health, or a related field preferred.
* 1-3 years of experience in supervising casework, human services, or disaster staff teams is required.
* Fluency in Spanish, French, Arabic, Wolof, or one or more other West African languages required.
* Previous experience working with immigrant or asylum-seeking populations is strongly preferred.
* Experience in disaster, emergency, or public health services is a plus.
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage staff teams effectively.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to engage with clients and team members professionally and empathetically.
* Proficient in Data Entry as well as the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook) and databases.
* Knowledge of the New York City social service landscape and community resources is a plus.
* Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion values, fostering an environment of respect for all.

**Salary range, $55,000 to $60,000 commensurate with experience – with excellent benefits.**  

**No Phone Calls: Send Cover Letter, Resume & 3 Professional References to** **jobs@nydis.org**

*All qualified candidates should apply; candidates from ethnic and religious minorities are strongly encouraged to apply. NYDIS does not discriminate against any individual or group for reasons of age, color, creed, culture, gender, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, or race.*

title: RN/Cardiac Cath Lab
description:
**Position Summary**
====================


The Registered Nurse provides direct patient care. The Registered Nurse collaborates with patients, family/significant others, peers, physicians and other members of the interdisciplinary healthcare team in the delivery of healthcare services to patients. The Registered Nurse assesses the patient’s needs, plans care, implements and evaluates the medical and nursing regimens in accordance with the hospital and nursing philosophy, policies/procedures and standards. He or she demonstrates leadership skills and commitment to professional accountability and growth


**Essential Functions and Responsibilities Includes the Following:**
====================================================================


* Understands and adheres to the WPH Performance Standards, Policies and Behaviors.


* Utilizes the nursing process to meet the age specific needs of the patient in all aspects of care: biophysical, psychosocial, education, safety/ environment and discharge planning


* Utilizes appropriate steps in the decision making process to include recognition and priority setting related to patient care and unit-based issues. Addresses issues with appropriate actions


* Collaborates and communicates with the interdisciplinary health care team


* Integrates patient rights and nursing ethics into work practice


* Adheres to infection control standards to reduce the risk of nosocomial infections to patient and staff.


* Adheres to the tenets of the Joint Commission National Patient Safety Goals


* Delegates activities to ancillary staff as it relates to the State Nurse Practice Act


* Adheres to the ANA Code of Nursing Ethics & Scope and Standards of Nursing Practice


* Supports, promotes, and practices within the WPH Professional Nursing Practice Model


* Sustains and advances the Magnet model


* Participates in the Performance Improvement initiatives


* Completes competency requirements


* Attends mandatory in-services


* Attends staff meetings as required/requested


* Utilizes cost containment practices


* Assumes Charge Nurse responsibility


* Performs other related duties as assigned


**Education & Experience Requirements**
=======================================


* Graduate from an accredited school of nursing with current New York registration


* Baccalaureate in Nursing (BSN) required for all external RNs hired on or after January 1st, 2018.


* All RNs hired on or after January 1st 2016 but before January 1st 2018, must have a minimum of a BSN or show evidence of enrollment and completion of BSN by January 1st, 2020.


* All RNs hired before January 1st 2016 must have BSN by January 1st, 2022.


* Knowledge of current nursing, medical and health trends and practices in rendering of patient care.


* One year of acute care nursing experience preferred for areas other than medical surgical or step-down


* BLS certification (through American Heart Association) is required.


* As of January 1st, 2017, ACLS certification (through American Heart Association) is required for all RNs, except for NICU and OR RNs. Current nurses will have 12 months to receive this certification (1/1/18). Current nurses on Mother/Baby will have until 1/1/19 to receive this certification. All newly hired, inexperienced nurses must receive this certification within 12 months. All newly hired, experienced nurses must receive this certification within 6 months.


* PALS certification (through American Heart Association) is required for all RNs working in the PACU, 5I Pediatrics, Emergency Department, Armonk Urgent Care and Ambulatory Surgery. All newly hired, inexperienced nurses must receive this certification within 12 months. All newly hired, experienced nurses must receive this certification within 6 months.


* NRP certification is required for all RNs working in the Mother-Baby unit, Labor & Delivery and NICU. All newly hired nurses to the NICU, L&D and the Mother-Baby unit must receive this certification within 6 months.


* Successful completion of Department and Unit Orientation Program


**Core Competencies**
=====================


* Teamwork & Adaptability
* Acts as a Professional Role Model
* Assessment Skills
* Excellent Communication Skills (both verbal and written)
* Attention to Detail
* Planning & Organizing
* Sound Problem-Solving, Judgment and Decision-Making Skills
* Stress Tolerance

**Physical/Mental Demands/Requirements & Work Environment**
===========================================================


* May be exposed to chemicals necessary to perform required tasks. Any hazardous chemicals the employee may be exposed to are listed in the hospital’s SDS (Safety Data Sheet) data base and accessed through the hospital’s Intranet site (Employee Tools/SDS Access). A copy of the SDS data base can also be found at the hospital switchboard, saved on a disc.
* Position requires ability to move about freely at least 85 per cent of the time.
* Must be able to remain stationary for extended/prolonged periods
* Frequently moves/transports objects up to fifty (50) pounds and must be able to move patients of all weights with a minimum of one (1) assist or assistive device/equipment
* Must be able to work in environment with continuous interruptions
* Must be able to assess and respond to rapidly changing situational needs of patients, department and hospital
* Must be able to adapt in a high stress and fast-paced environment with multiple interruptions
* Must be able to detect sounds and respond to emergency sounds/signals at all times
* Must be able to constantly operate computer, equipment and other devices
* Position requires ability to concentrate on fine detail with interruptions and attend to tasks for more than sixty (60) minutes at a time.
* Individual must be able to understand and relate to theories behind several related concepts and remember multiple tasks given during the course of a day.

**Primary Population Served**
=============================


Check appropriate box(s) below:


* Neonatal (birth – 28 days)
* Patients with exceptional communication needs
  
  

* Infant (29 days – less than 1 year)
* Patients with developmental delays
  
  

* Pediatric (1 – 12 years)
* Patients at end of life
  
  

* Adolescent (13 – 17 years)
* Patients under isolation precautions
  
  

* Adult (18 – 64 years)
* Patients with cultural needs
  
  

* Geriatric (> 65 years)
  
All populations

  

  

* Bariatric Patients with weight related comorbidities
* Non-patient care population
  
  

  

***The responsibilities and tasks outlined in this job description are not exhaustive and may change as determined by the needs of White Plains Hospital.***


***Salary Range: $105,216.1430 - $145,113.14***

  

Location: White Plains Hospital · Cardiac Catheterization Lab  

Schedule: Per Diem, Day, 10 or 12 hour shifts varied start times, 0630-0900 M-F, call as required

title: Director of Global Payroll
description:
**About the Role**



This role requires a deep understanding of payroll processes, compliance regulations, and international payroll practices. The role is responsible for managing our global payroll operations, and aligning systems, processes, and tools across each of our regions. This leader will undertake all global payroll transformation projects, provide insight to various stakeholders, and manage risks. They will act as a critical member of the leadership team in the development and execution of short-term and long-range plans, corporate goals, strategic planning, and growth objectives.


**What does a great Director of Global Payroll do?**



The individual in this role will lead a team to ensure accurate and timely payroll processing for employees worldwide. They will act as a main point of contact for both employees and external vendors regarding payroll issues, so a strong service-oriented approach and high sense of urgency are critical. They will be responsible for oversight and execution of all payroll tools, data & analytics insights, and organizational government reporting requirements related to employees. Additionally, they will drive continuous process improvements.


**How you will provide meaningful contributions:**


* Independently and effectively manage all payroll operations related to employee compensation, bonuses, commissions, equity, benefits, etc.; this includes processing payroll for ~1100 employees in the US, Canada, Europe, and Asia, in a timely and accurate manner.
* Identify gaps in processes and work towards solution and implementation to create clear standards.
* Lead the design, implementation, and documentation of key process improvements and SOX compliant internal controls.
* Work closely with Accounting to perform monthly payroll close duties. This includes preparation and review of period-end accruals, assist with journal entries for all payroll and benefits, preparation of payroll account reconciliations, payroll related variance analysis, and other duties related to accounting payroll functions.
* Work with federal, state, and local tax agencies to ensure filing compliance, respond to notices, and maintain good account standing – both Domestically and Internationally
* Support annual Financial, Worker’s Comp, 401k, and other audits as required
* Manage annual preparation and delivery of Form W-2s and 1099’s
* Respond to employee inquiries and requests regarding payroll matters ensuring the highest customer satisfaction
* Provide formal and ad-hoc analysis and reporting of payroll, benefits, and headcount
* Partner with internal constituents to continuously deliver system enhancements, improve workflows, increase functionality and introduce new modules as business requirements evolve
* Create metrics, reports and dashboards that provide accurate and actionable insights related to workforce trends
* Lead and develop a team of payroll professionals globally including resource planning and optimization of team structure
* Drive consistent, global processes and coordinate regional efforts towards global process standardization in line with statutory requirements, while allowing local flexibility as needed.
* Perform other duties and special projects as assigned


**Required qualifications for the role**


* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or Business and/or equivalent combination of education or 15+ years experience leading a global payroll team
* 5-10 years of relevant multi-state and international payroll experience
* Advanced expertise with cloud-based automated HRIS and payroll systems
* Highly analytical with a strong working knowledge of payroll and tax processes with multiple withholdings, benefits (health and welfare and retirement), garnishments, labor compliance, accounting principles related to payroll, and Federal, State and local regulations
* Capable of dealing effectively, diplomatically, courteously and confidentially with all levels of employees
* Excellent organization, prioritization and communication skills, including a strong attention to detail and the ability to meet deadlines consistently.


**Preferred Skills / Experience**



Certified Payroll Professional (CPP) certification

  


**About InvestCloud**



InvestCloud is the global technology leader in digital transformations for the financial services industry, supporting over $6 trillion of assets with over 550 direct clients, from wealth managers, institutional investors and asset managers to family offices, asset services companies, financial platforms, and banks. InvestCloud specializes in digital platforms that enable the development of financial solutions, pre-integrated into the cloud. The company offers on-demand client experiences and intuitive operations solutions using an ever-expanding suite of modular products, resulting in best-in-class experiences for the financial services industry. Headquartered in Los Angeles, InvestCloud has over 20 global offices including New York, London, Geneva, Singapore, Tokyo, and Sydney. InvestCloud is backed by Motive Partners (together with its affiliates) and Clearlake Capital Group, L.P. (together with its affiliates). For more information, visit InvestCloud.com.

  



The actual salary will vary based on applicant’s education, experience, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity and alignment with market data. The salary may also be adjusted based on the applicant’s geographic location. Salary range: $150,000 - 190,000

  



InvestCloud is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Retail Consultant | Greenwich | Part Time
description:
For over 35 years, Aesop has carefully cultivated an inspiring and inclusive environment in which our employees are supported and encouraged to thrive. As a global retail organization, we offer professional development and advancement opportunities to complement career goals and aspirations.  



Our approach to skin care involves meticulous attention to detail, using only the most efficacious ingredients to create formulations which stir the self and senses. The same meticulous approach is taken during our recruitment process, seeking out considered and inspired individuals with a wealth of perspectives who bring out the best in themselves and others.  



We aim to strike the right balance between people, planet and profit, actively reducing our footprint on the planet that generously sustains us. So far, this journey has led us to become a certified B Corp. We are committed to building a more sustainable and inclusive society.  



**Role purpose**

As a Retail Consultant, you embody our desire to engage, listen and guide customers to products that are relevant to them. You will welcome customers into our spaces and through intentional interactions deepen the way our products are experienced. In demonstrating products that address customer needs you will deliver an exceptional, inclusive customer experience that contributes to our overall commercial success.  



**What we are looking for**

* Experience operating within a customer service role or environment
* Effective selling skills and the ability to drive commercial outcomes
* Ability to consistently introduce Aesop products to clients through hand demonstrations
* History of successfully participating in and contributing to a team
* Demonstrated ability to utilise empathy to manage interpersonal relationships and contribute to a positive and inclusive experience for all
* Open mindset and deep curiosity seeking to understand others, listen without judgement and act on diverse perspectives
* Strong communication and problem-solving skills
* Working knowledge of skin care and skin care industry ( advantageous )
* Knowledge of hair care, body care, fragrance and home categories ( advantageous )
* This position is part time and operates an on-site working pattern. Successful candidates will have a minimum of three days availability weekly, in addition to full availability on weekends.
**What’s** **on offer**

We take a holistic approach to employment, promoting professional development, career growth, employee wellbeing initiatives and encouraging deep connections with the local community through the Aesop Foundation, volunteering and matched giving programs. Employee benefits include -


* Pay rate of $ 21.00 / hr
* Access to employee assistance programs, complimentary subscription to Headspace mindfulness app, therapy/coaching sessions through Modern Health
Aesop is committed to attracting, developing and retaining the very best people by offering a creative and inclusive workplace where talent is truly recognized and rewarded. We are committed to promoting inclusion for all with the belief that diversity, inclusion and belonging plays an important role in the success of our organization. We actively encourage everyone to consider becoming a part of our journey.

title: Director of Housekeeping
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking a caring and qualified individual to serve as **Director of Housekeeping.** The ideal candidate will be thorough and meticulous and will pay extraordinary attention to detail in maintaining the highest standards of housekeeping excellence at our beautiful and luxurious community.


The Director of Housekeeping is a working supervisor role. You will be responsible for planning, organizing, developing and directing overall Housekeeping and Laundry operations in compliance with all government and company standards and guidelines. In this position, you will be required to inspect, maintain and assure that the highest degree of resident quality and comfort is achieved at all times.

**Additional responsibilities include:**

* Scheduling team members to ensure sufficient service and coverage while ensuring working hours remain within budget
* Hiring and scheduling team members of the Housekeeping Department (Housekeepers, Porters and Laundry Assistants)
* Inspecting and evaluating the physical condition of all areas of the building and coordinating with the Maintenance Department for any needed repairs
* Inspecting all work in progress completed by team members or external contractors, while maintaining cleanliness checklists
* Training team members and providing monthly in-services support for staff
* Maintaining strict inventory levels and ordering supplies as needed
* Keeping all files and records consistent with the seamless functioning of the department
* Performing regular inspections of resident apartments and areas for sanitation, safety and proper performance of assigned tasks
* Overseeing the shampooing of rugs for both resident and common areas
* Performing cleaning tasks in times of emergency or team member shortages
* Ensuring proper safety and security regarding resident belongings and items used in executing housekeeping and laundry functions


Full-time schedule requires working one weekend day per week (Tues-Sat or Sun-Thurs).

**Qualifications:**

* Two (2) years' experience as a supervisor in housekeeping and laundry operations
* Must have a working knowledge of Microsoft Office
* Possess leadership abilities and have good communication skills
* Ability to converse with team members, residents and their families in English
* Bilingual (Spanish/English) a plus

**Benefits include:**

* Salary increases based on annual performance
* Annual team appreciation events, quarterly team appreciation bonuses, and an annual holiday bonus
* 401K plan
* AFLAC Benefits
* Company-paid life insurance policy
* PTO days, company-paid holidays, with a PTO cash-out option annually
* Optional lunch for all employees
* Available health, dental and vision coverage
company_description: The Bristal Assisted Living is the premier in senior living with 24 locations throughout the tri-state area inlcuding Long Island, Westchester, Manhattan, and New Jersey.

title: Director of Memory Care/Reflections
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking a caring, dedicated and experienced LPN nurse supervisor to become the **Director of Reflections,** our dedicated Alzheimer's and dementia Memory Care Neighborhood at our beautiful and luxurious community. In this crucial role, you will be responsible for the day-to-day management and success of the Reflections Program, including planning, organizing and coordinating special needs programs. You will also provide team member supervision and training, and act as a liaison and advocate for our residents and their families. This is a hands-on position requiring occasional participation in assisting residents with ADLs.

**Additional responsibilities include:**

* Ensuring that resident care and management needs are sufficiently and appropriately assessed
* Serving as the liaison between residents, the resident's legal representatives, their families, administrative staff and community-based service providers
* Motivating and developing team members, including providing in-service education of the special needs program to Reflections area team members on health/wellness related topics
* Leading the daily operations of the Reflections Memory Care area and ensuring compliance with company and Department of Health (DOH) regulatory policies and standards regarding resident admission and discharge procedure as well as compiling appropriate medical case notes and other required documentation
* Scheduling and overseeing team members and assisting with medication management


Full-time schedule requires working one weekend day per week (Tues-Sat or Sun-Thurs).

**Qualifications:**

* At least three (3) years working intimately with Alzheimer's or dementia patients and a minimum 5 years' experience working with the geriatric population
* Graduate from an accredited school of nursing and an active Licensed Practical Nurse-LPN
* A minimum of two (2 ) years of supervisory experience in an assisted living, skilled nursing, clinical or similar healthcare related field is preferred
* Experience planning and administering in-service education programs
* Demonstrate exceptional leadership skills as a mentor who can lead by example
* Possess a working knowledge of medical and nursing terminology
* Knowledge of geriatric care needs, supervision and administration
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to speak clearly, concisely and confidently with residents and their families, physicians, property personnel and other key stakeholders
* Exceptional multitasking, organizational and time management skills a must
* Ability and flexibility to excel despite frequent work interruptions
* Reset priorities in order to complete work responsibilities in a timely manner
* Apply discretion in handling confidential information
* Ability to cope with the mental and emotional stress related to working with special needs population
* Strong computer skills and proficiency with Microsoft Office

**Benefits include:**

* Salary increases based on annual performance
* Annual team appreciation events, quarterly team appreciation bonuses, and an annual holiday bonus
* 401K plan
* AFLAC Benefits
* Company-paid life insurance policy
* PTO days, company-paid holidays, with a PTO cash-out option annually
* Optional lunch for all employees
* Available health, dental and vision coverage
* $6,000 tuition reimbursement per year for the LPN to RN Bridge Program

title: Director of Wellness - RN
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking a **Director of Wellness** with supervisory experience in geriatric services to direct, manage and support our Wellness Department. This is a unique, exciting and rewarding opportunity, helping to maintain a Health Services Department of excellence within our beautiful and luxurious community.


If you are a caring, hardworking and reliable nurse looking to make a tangible difference in the joy and happiness of a senior's life — and is someone who is not afraid to be hands-on — then we're looking for you to be a part of our dedicated world-class team. The successful RN in this role must possess an abiding respect for and knowledge of the elderly and have an extraordinary ability to multitask under pressure. With an emphasis on geriatric care management, the Director of Wellness is an essential position, reporting to the Executive Director.


You must be a nurse with proven capabilities in managing a team, scheduling employees, maintaining charts, overseeing medication administration and creating team member assignments. You must have a proven track record for inspiring and leading a unified, cohesive team in excelling for the good of the community. You will also support our Memory Care Department, which serves residents with Alzheimer's and other forms of dementia, and also falls within the purview of the Wellness Department under the administration of the DON and with the support of the Director of Memory Care, Wellness Secretary and Director of Case Management.

**Additional responsibilities include:**

* Managing daily day operations for the Resident Health Services Department 24/7/365
* Demonstrating skilled and confident leadership in hiring, training and scheduling team members
* Developing and coordinating service plans
* Conducting resident assessments, both on and off site, in conjunction with the Case Manager
* Communicating with physicians, residents and families
* Ensuring regulatory compliance in accordance with the New York State Department of Health


Full-time schedule requires working one weekend day per week (Tues-Sat or Sun-Thurs).

**Qualifications:**

* Must have an active New York State RN License
* Knowledge of New York State Department of Health regulations for Adult Home or Enriched Housing is a huge plus
* Four-plus (4+) years gerontological nursing and administration experience required
* Case Management experience a plus
* Excellent people skills and the ability to communicate effectively across diverse audiences
* Successful management or supervisory methodology with experience managing a department as well as interviewing, hiring, scheduling and training team members
* Proficient computer skills (Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook)
* Be a person of the utmost integrity, with an absolute commitment to resident care
* Hold experience in assisted living, home health or a skilled nursing setting
* Having a sense of humor, confidence and composure-under-pressure are key qualities that we look for!

**Benefits include:**

* Salary increases based on annual performance
* Annual team appreciation events, quarterly team appreciation bonuses, and an annual holiday bonus
* 401K plan
* AFLAC Benefits
* Company-paid life insurance policy
* PTO days, company-paid holidays, with a PTO cash-out option annually

title: NP/PA – Neurocritical care
description:
**NP/PA – Neurocritical care** 

The primary role of the Nurse Practitioner/Physician Assistant is to provide clinical management for critically ill complex neuro patients utilizing evidence-based clinical practice standards under the supervision of the Neuro ICU supervising physician and attending backup ICU physicians. The NP/PA will also be expected to assist with emergency management of neuro patients outside of ICU and respond to inpatient code strokes. A 24-hour coverage will be divided amongst multiple nurse practitioners.

We are currently seeking **F/T** **Nurse Practitioners**/**Physician Assistants** with prior “neuro” experience to join our team. Our ideal candidates will be flexible, willing, and able to work a combination of days, nights, and weekends.

**Shift:** 3 X 12-hour shifts

**Additional Responsibilities:**

* Obtain health histories and complete neuro and physical examinations. Document pertinent findings. Order and interpret appropriate diagnostic and laboratory tests. Explain the necessity and nature of anticipated effects of procedure(s) to patients, families, healthcare team members, and students.
* Formulate and implement a treatment plan in collaboration with the multi-disciplinary team.
* Assess the patient for change in status and institute appropriate interventions to stabilize the patient.
* Provide family-centered care by communicating with the family regarding the changing health care needs of the patient.
* Perform and participate in quality performance improvement activities and clinical research.
* Serve as a clinical expert and leadership consultant to nursing, healthcare team members, and the larger community.

**PA Requirements:**

* Graduate of an accredited (Accreditation Review Committee for Physician Assistant Programs (ARC-PA) program, required.
* A licensed Physician Assistant by the New York State Department of Education is required.
* **Minimum of 2 years acute Critical Care (MICU, SICU) experience preferred but not required.**
* Current NCCPA Certification from the National Commission on the Certification of Physician Assistants (NCCPA), is required.
* Current BLS and ACLS certifications, required.

**NP Requirements:** 

* Current NYS Nurse Practitioner License (master’s degree-Advanced practice)
* **Must have Minimum of 2 years acute Critical Care (MICU, SICU) experience required**.
* Current BLS and ACLS certification, required.
* Certification as a Nurse Practitioner with prescription privileges and DEA certification

title: Operations Lead
description:
At Chick-fil-A, Shift Leaders are responsible for assisting the management team in all aspects of shift management and ensuring that each restaurant guest has an outstanding experience. Team Leaders are responsible for supervising assigned stations for an entire shift and may be assigned to open or close the restaurant in the absence of a manager; following established opening and closing procedures.

 **Responsibilities include:**

* Insures that Team Members follow recipes and read tickets to accurately prepare all orders.
* Insures that Team Members are extremely accurate with weights and measurements for all recipe items.
* Insures that Team Members work at a pace to maintain restaurant's established speed of service guidelines.
* Insures that workstations are clean at all times.
* Executes proper security and cash handling and control procedures and holds registers accountable to adhering to policies and procedures.
* Insures that Team Members monitor dining room, restroom, lobby, front counter, kitchen and overall facility cleanliness.
* Addresses & deescalates guest issues that may arise; consults with management regarding complex issues.
* Maintains a positive working relationship and treats all Team Members with respect while providing them with direction and feedback.
* Communicates and addresses Team Member performance and policy/procedure violations to management for appropriate handling.
* Strictly adheres and enforces all Company policies and procedures and consistently.

 **A job at Chick-fil-A is more than just a job. It's a stepping-stone to a successful future in the world of business. Here are some of the great benefits of working at Chick-fil-A:**

* **Flexible Hours** - You probably have commitments to your family, friends, school or sports teams. We will try to arrange your work schedule around them.
* **Closed Sundays** - All Chick-fil-A restaurants are closed on Sundays so you can have a day off to spend with family and friends.
* **Work Directly With A Chick-fil-A Operator** - The Operator is responsible for the operation of the restaurant, who invests time in his or her employees, teaching them leadership skills and important business expertise.
* **Competitive Pay** - Along with a competitive paycheck, you will work in a nurturing environment where you will learn valuable business and people skills.
* **It's a Great Place to Work** - At Chick-fil-A, our Operators consider their team members to be more than just employees, they are a highly valued part of each Chick-fil-A restaurant. Our high retention rate is proof that team members really enjoy working at Chick-fil-A.

**REQUIREMENTS**
----------------

* Previous customer service experience preferred
* Previous leadership experience an asset
* Hard-working
* Team-oriented
* Friendly
* Honest
* Great customer skills
* Solutions Oriented

  

Have you dreamed about a career in Chick-fil-A, the premier restaurant chain in the country? Are you searching for a role that’s more than a paycheck, a job that satisfies both your ambitions and your values? Do you want to work for a boss that cares about your development more than just your results? Are you ready for the kind of challenges that bring about genuine growth? If you’ve answered yes to any of these questions, we have an opportunity for you…Apply to be a leader at Fulton St. CFA in the heart of lower Manhattan.
company_description: Chick-fil-A, Inc. is the third largest quick-service restaurant company in the United States, known for its freshly-prepared food, signature hospitality and unique franchise model.

title: Associate Executive Director
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


NYC Health + Hospitals/Metropolitan is the community hospital of choice for residents of East Harlem, northern Manhattan, and neighboring communities. The hospital provides culturally-sensitive care in a welcoming and hospitable setting, emphasizing primary care medicine and utilizing the latest advances in medical science. Metropolitan delivers high quality health services with compassion, dignity, and respect to all, without exception. Since its founding in 1875, the hospital has been affiliated with New York Medical College, representing the oldest partnership between a hospital and a private medical school in the United States. Metropolitan is a part of the NYC Health + Hospitals, the largest municipal hospital and health care system in the country.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Work Shifts**
---------------

  

  

  

  

**9:00 A.M – 5:00 P.M**

  

**Job Description**
-------------------

  


**PURPOSE OF POSITION:**  

This position is a backfill for the AED Support Service, who resigned. Under direction of the Chief Operating Officer, this position exercises wide latitude of independent judgment and initiative in operations and maintenance of the facility.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Manages all aspects of operations and maintenance of the facility; including management of the physical plant, buildings, and grounds and management of ancillary support services.
* Oversee and facilitate project management for various large and complex programs and projects related to construction, improvements and maintenance; monitor work flow; review and evaluate work product, methods, and procedures.
* Develop and implement short and long-term objectives, departmental policies and procedures, and standards of work performance for 24-hour coverage, operation, maintenance, and repair of building and utility system.
* Coordinate work with other departments as well as outside agencies as necessary. Participate in the strategic planning for the division; assist in the preparation and administration of the division’s improvement goals.
* Develop, monitor and review the division’s budget; ensure fiscal soundness of the division by working with Hospital Administration to develop, justify and administer the division’s capital and operating budgets
* Assist in the selection, training and performance evaluation of personnel; make recommendations and work with employees to correct deficiencies; when necessary, initiate personnel actions such as promotions, transfers, discharges and disciplinary actions.
* Develop policies and programs to ensure division activities comply with pertinent federal, state, county, and local laws and regulations and assist in the coordination of departmental programs with those of federal, state, county, and local regulatory agencies.
* Effectively communicate status of projects on regular basis to key stakeholders (Hospital Administration, Union, Department personnel, etc.).
* Coordinate, facilitate, attend, chair and lead a variety of hospital-wide meetings related to the environment of care; serve on committees as requested; represent the Division and make oral presentations at meetings and other events.
* Attend construction meetings and work with architects, engineers, contractors, specialists and Department staff to ensure that operational and maintenance concerns are incorporated into building projects.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

  


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. A Master’s Degree with a specialization in Hospital Administration, Health Care Administration, Administrative Medicine or in Public Health when conferred for a program in Hospital Administration from an accredited college or university; and,  

  

2. Six years of high-level responsible experience in Hospital Administration, Business Administration, Public Administration or an equivalent field, or as an Assistant to a Hospital Administrator in a position of direct responsibility for operations of a major part or all of a hospital, including substantial exposure in meeting community health needs; or,  

  

3. An equivalent combination of training, education and experience in related fields and educational disciplines; and,  

  

4. title: Travel RN - Endoscopy
description:
Job Function: 01. ASSESSMENT: Appropriately admits patients following proper patient identification procedure Performs patient assessment that is systemic, comprehensive and accurate. Assesses chart findings and physical status of each patient, reporting abnormal findings to the physicians. Explains to the patient and their family members the important processes they will need to know while they are a patient here.

Job Function: 02. DIAGNOSIS Identifies patient needs and problems. Analyzes assessment data to determine relevant patient diagnosis.

Job Function: 03. PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION Plans for the nursing care of patient utilizing ANA and SGNA Standards of Clinical Nursing Practice. Integrates and implements nursing practice across the continuum of care. Maintains open lines of communication with personnel in all areas to maintain maximum efficiency while respecting the privacy and confidentiality of others.

Job Function: 04. EVALUATION Evaluates effectiveness of intervention and revises Plan of Care as appropriate. Evaluates individualized patient goals by utilizing established policies and standards of care.

Job Function: 05. DOCUMENTATION Documents legibly and accurately in completing the patient chart. Documents all patient/ family teaching interventions and responses. Documents patient responses to all medical and nursing interventions as per nursing standards.

Job Function: 06. COLLABORATION Acts as a patient advocate and assures that a patients’ rights are respected. Promotes an environment where the patient and family is at the center and the patient care team works cooperatively toward their goal and objectives. Collaborates with physicians and other specialty caregivers to optimize patient and family care. Initiates and maintains an open line of communication with patients and their families to expedite delays, cares for their concerns or notifies charge nurse about unresolved problems needing resolution. Demonstrates clinical excellence and serves as a resource for peers. Demonstrates sound decision-making skills & flexibility in administrative & clinical practices. Utilizes nursing protocols & supports hospital policies and procedures.

Job Function: 07. EDUCATION Orients and educates new staff members as to proper use of equipment and department policies and procedures. Demonstrates professional practice responsibility; fulfills mandatory education obligations. Role model’s patient care activities, tasks, and behaviors to advance practice of endoscopy technician.

Job Function: 08. SAFETY Recognizes emergency situations and reacts appropriately. Maintains a safe clean patient care environment. Demonstrates knowledge and proper administration of medication. Maintains sterile field and adheres to standards for sterile procedures, if applicable. Assists with proper collection, labeling and processing of specimens as directed by physician. Maintains all equipment as per policy and procedure and recognizes and reports any hazardous situation to supervisor.

Job Function: 09. EQUIPMENT FUNCTION. Anticipates, provides and utilizes proper instrumentation, supplies and equipment. Maintains orderly and proper functioning and storage of equipment. Assures proper disinfection technique, as per Infection Control Committee and department policy, on all instruments and equipment used in department. Possesses knowledge to assemble / disassemble all equipment used in department.

Skills:

Proficiency in written and oral communication. Ability to work independently and collaboratively as required. Basic Life Support for Healthcare Providers (BLS) and ACLS are required. Unit based education as assigned.

Education:

Graduate of an approved NLN nursing program. Current NJ license as a Professional Registered Nurse, BSN Preferred.

Languages:English Read Write SpeakCertifications & Licenses:ACLSBLSInfection ControlProficiency in written and oral communication. Ability to work independently and collaboratively asRNRegistered Nurse

Job Types: Travel nursing, Contract

Pay: $75.00 - $80.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Physical Setting:

* Hospital

Language:

* English (Required)

License/Certification:

* BLS Certification (Required)
* RN License (Required)
* ACLS Certification (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Pompton Plains, NJ 07444 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Brand Ambassador/Sales Associate
description:
**Join the Green Revolution at Easyplant!** 

Easyplant is on a mission to make plant parenting a breeze! Imagine only watering your plants once a month – that's the magic of our self-watering plant system. It all started in 2016 with two best friends who wanted to make home decorating fun and easy. First, they created Mixtiles, the #1 wall-decor brand in the US, transforming smartphone photos into stunning wall art. But they didn't stop there! Realizing the struggle people face with keeping houseplants alive, they rallied top engineers to solve this problem. Two years later, Easyplant was born, revolutionizing how we care for our green friends.

Our e-commerce success has been phenomenal, and now we’re excited to bring our innovative products to retail. We envision a world where everyone can enjoy the beauty and benefits of nature at home, without the hassle of plant care. If this vision excites you, come join our mission to spread greenery everywhere!

**Why You'll Love Working at Easyplant:**

At Easyplant, we believe in loving what you do and doing what you love. We’re a team that values sincerity, authenticity, and joyful customer interactions. Our retail crew is the face of our brand, connecting customers with our amazing plants, unique technology, and the joy of green living.

**Who We're Looking For:**

We need Plant Ambassadors in NYC who are passionate about creating unforgettable experiences for plant lovers. Whether you have a green thumb, love botany, or are just as plant-obsessed as we are, we want you to help our customers become plant aficionados. Here’s what we’re looking for:

* **Optimistic and Service-Minded**: You’re always positive and eager to delight our guests and support your team.
* **Confident Communicators**: You know that great customer service is personal. You make every interaction enjoyable and easy.
* **Emotionally Intelligent**: You enjoy meeting new people, helping them explore plant care, and empathizing with their needs.
* **Problem Solvers**: You love a good challenge, adapt well to change, and take pride in your work.

**What You'll Do:**

* **Customer Engagement**: Welcome visitors and provide top-notch service from start to finish.
* **Product Education**: Show off our innovative pots, share plant care tips, and guide customers to the perfect purchase.
* **Sales Driving**: Work with your team to meet sales goals and build strong customer relationships.
* **Follow-Up**: Check in with customers post-purchase to ensure satisfaction and encourage repeat visits.
* **Team Participation**: Join store meetings and training to continually improve.
* **POS Transactions**: Handle sales accurately and keep necessary records.
* **Inventory Management**: Help receive shipments and keep our plants organized and healthy.
* **Event Support**: Assist in the execution of in-store special events.
* **Store Maintenance**: Participate in daily operations like cleaning and organizing stock.

**About You:**

* A collaborative and proactive team player.
* Eager to take on challenges with a positive, can-do attitude.
* Open to giving and receiving feedback to enhance the store and service.
* Experience in retail or hospitality is a plus.
* Shopify experience is a bonus.
* Flexible schedule, including evenings and weekends.

**What We Offer:**

* Competitive hourly rates
* Medical benefits after 90 days
* Paid time off and holidays
* Generous employee discount
* Awesome Easyplant swag
* Part-time and full-time roles available

*Easyplant is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.*

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $23.00 per hour

Expected hours: 8 – 20 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Opportunities for advancement
* Paid training

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Morning shift
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person

title: Ops Specialist CA Reorg (JSY)
description:
Job Title - Ops Specialist CA Reorg (JSY)
  
  

Number of Positions 1
  
  

**Contract:** 12 months
  
  

Job Location - 1150, Plaza Five, Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America, 07311
  
  

Pay Rate - $24/hr
  
  

Job Start Date - 10/17/24
  
  

Job End Date - 10/17/25
  
  

Job Description -
  
  

**Manager Notes:**  

**Required Skills:** Attention to detail, able to work fast, and work under pressure.
  
**Hybrid Schedule:** 3 days in the office, 2 days home.
  
  

Ops Specialist CA Reorg is responsible for performing specialized operational securities processing activities in support of the firms business lines. This would include activities such as: notification announcement input, instruction receipt and authentication, instruction entry, processing and recording, reporting and acknowledgement, and reconciliation. Primary focus is on daily deliverables and execution of defined procedures and analysis while gaining and understanding the big picture and how their work impacts the firm. Individuals will have their work thoroughly reviewed and validated by more senior personnel.
  
  

**Roles:**  

* Scrubbing Announcements from Market Data Vendors, Company Information, and Depositories and Agents
* Input information into Corporate Action platform for Income and Mandatory Actions \\* Identify complex events and communicate to team members.
* Processing of Class Action suits
* Process client instructions through manual entry into the Corporate Actions platform.
* Process agent confirmations through the Corporate Actions platform for communication to clients. \\* Written and verbal communication of uninstructed positions to clients on a daily basis.
* Processing of client account profile requests for Corporate Actions.
* Manual entry of payments into the Corporate Actions platform.
* Balancing and reconciling of positions related to corporate action activity.
* Reconciliation of receivables and payables to ensure accurate client cash projections.
* Communication of uninstructed positions via phone call to clients.
* Communicate as part of a team to ensure superior client service.
* Participate in client presentations or calls.
* Identify problem items.
* Communicate professionally and constructively to effectively resolve issues in a timely and efficient manner.


Qualification
  
  

BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience. Demonstrated PC skills.
  
  

Ability to identify, escalate and resolve a problem.
  
  

Ability to communicate professionally through effective verbal and written skills.
  
  

Ability to manage time efficiently and effectively.
  
  

Organizational skills and detail-oriented.
  
  

Ability to multi-task. Ability to work in a team environment.
  
  

Ability to process transactions timely and accurately Ability to meet deadlines and work under pressure.

title: Registered Nurse Emergency Room
description:
**Job Summary**


Treat actual or potential health problems using the nursing diagnosis and case management. Teach, counsel and provide supportive care to the patient and their significant others

  


**Essential Functions**


* Interviews patient (if possible) and/or family to obtain required history and make an accurate assessment.
* Assigns a triage priority based on observations and available information.
* Initiates diagnostic and therapeutic measures as indicated by standing protocols.
* Calls for crisis intervention if appropriate.
* Communicates and acts as liaison between the patient, family, and health professionals in a manner that respects confidentiality and dignity.
* Coordinates the needs of the patient with supporting departments and assists in solving problems related to the welfare of patient and staff.
* Charts concisely, descriptively, and legibly indicating patient’s progress or lack or progress.
* Performs nursing procedures safely and efficiently.
* Demonstrates understanding of, and adheres to, the hospital’s infection control protocols.
* Demonstrates compliance with exiting standards and policies.

  




**Other Duties**


Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

  


**Minimum Education/Certifications**  

Graduate of an accredited program in nursing.


Current Registered Nurse license to practice in the state of NJ.


Certifications required: BLS (American Heart Association),


ACLS - Advanced Cardiovascular Life Support and PALS – Pediatric Advanced Life Support. IV Certification preferred.

  

**Minimum Work Experience**  

2 year or more experience in an acute care setting preferred. Critical care experience preferred


**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work:** Must be willing to work holidays, weekends and provide additional coverage as needed


**Physical Demands Analysis**:  

The following tables detail the individual physical demands using the following six categories: Mobility, Strength, Upper Extremity Postural Activity, Sensory/Perceptual, Work Environment, and Conditions of Work

  

  

Location: CareWell Health · Emergency Department  

Schedule: Per Diem, Days, 7am-730pm

title: Staff Nurse(PH)-Emergency Room Services Adult
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Lincoln Medical and Mental Health Center is one of New York City’s premier acute care hospitals. Located in Downtown Bronx, Lincoln is a teaching hospital renowned for its Centers of Excellence, and a recognized industry leader in the implementation of state-of-the art medical technology and best practices. Our team of highly trained and caring medical professionals is dedicated to providing the highest quality health care that is safe, compassionate, culturally competent and patient-centered. Comprehensive services are offered in three major primary care areas: Medicine, Pediatrics, and Women’s Health in addition to more than eighty (80) specialty services. At Lincoln, the safety and comfort of our patients is our number one priority.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


Visit us at www.nyc.gov/html/hhc/lincoln.


**Duties & Responsibilities**
-----------------------------

  


1. Identifies and discriminates between physical and psycho-social signs and symptoms. Selects and performs those therapeutic measures which are essential for effective execution of the nursing regimen for assigned patients/clients.


2. Develops, implements and continuously evaluates the nursing regimen for assigned patients/clients.


3. Records and maintains nursing care plans and progress notes on patients/clients to ensure continuity of care.


4. Interprets and reports responses of patients/clients to appropriate members of the health team.


5. Participates with interdisciplinary health team members to plan a comprehensive patient care program.


6. Determines and assigns those components of the nursing regimen which may be carried out by allied nursing personnel.


7. Provides teaching, guidance and direction to allied nursing personnel in rendering patient care.


8. Participates in defining, implementing, maintaining and interpreting standards of nursing practice.


9. Participates in departmental and interdisciplinary conferences pertaining to policies and procedures affecting nursing practice.


10. Participates in determining conditions, resources and policies essential to the delivery of nursing care services.


11. Participates in development and maintenance of a system of evaluation of nursing care, practices and procedures, including evaluation of nursing personnel.


12. Interprets philosophy and objectives of agency and Nursing Department to patients/clients, families and other groups.


13. Maintains professional competence through participation in continuing education and other appropriate learning experiences.


14. Performs other professional nursing activities as delegated by nursing service administration.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. A valid New York State license and current registration to practice as a Registered Professional Nurse in New York State; and  

2. Holds, or obtains through facility orientation, a valid and current certification in Basic Life Support (BLS) through the American Heart Association (AHA).

Lincoln Medical & Mental Health Center

Bronx, NY 10451
