title: Part-time Office Coordinator
description:
**WHO ARE WE?**



There are over 30M small businesses in the United States, but only a tiny fraction of them have a workplace savings program in place. As the savings gap in the country widens, it's imperative that every worker has access to and participates in their company's savings program, such as a 401(k) or 403(b). We believe that American workers should have easy access to an inexpensive, flexible, and intuitive solution to save for a brighter future.  

  

Unfortunately, prior to Vestwell, small businesses have been neglected and underserved, with expensive, inflexible, poorly designed offerings built on old, mainframe software. Vestwell is changing that, starting with rebuilding the core infrastructure for the modern era.  

  

Vestwell's north star is to be the engine behind a $30T industry, powering all payroll-deducted workplace savings programs for small-to-midsize businesses, such as 401(k), 403(b), IRA, emergency savings accounts (ESA), health savings accounts (HSA), 529 college savings, and alike.  

  

Vestwell's focus is to build the most flexible, powerful workplace savings and investment platform, delivered through the hands and minds of their financial services partners with the help of payroll provider partners. The team at Vestwell makes the hard stuff look easy, by combining the expertise of financial advice with the sophistication of a technology provider.  

  

As a result, workplace providers are able to bestow the advice and solution employers and employees have been asking for, while growing and scaling along the way. Employers get a cost-effective solution designed for their needs without all the headaches, and employees get a user-friendly portal that helps them achieve their long-term saving goals.


**WHY VESTWELL?**



With backing from leading FinTech investors, as well as a growing team of dedicated professionals of strong industry pedigree, Vestwell is at the forefront of a much-needed change in a 40-year old industry. Our team believes in the mission we've set out to achieve and we are working hard to get there. We're ambitious, honest, thoughtful, and fun.



**Who Are We Looking For?**



Vestwell is looking for an Office Coordinator, part-time (9am-1pm EST, Monday - Friday) to undertake a variety of day-to-day office and clerical tasks onsite at our beautiful NYC HQ office. As the Office Coordinator, you will implement a high standard of cleanliness and orderliness for our office. The goal is to ensure that office operations are efficient and add maximum value to the organization. This role will report to the Senior Manager, Workplace Experience.



An excellent Office Coordinator is, above all, detail oriented, eager to learn, and believes no job is too big or small!


**What will you be doing:**


* Follow office workflow procedures to ensure maximum efficiency
* Maintain clean workspaces, common areas, offices, hallways and bathrooms
* Ensure that the office kitchen is well stocked with snacks, beverages, and utensils as needed
* Monitor office supplies inventory and inform the Senior Manager, Workplace Experience if we need to place orders or replenish supplies
* Assist in a variety of clerical tasks including but not limited to mailing, packaging, and other necessary duties related to administration
* Assist and support any Company wide events as needed


**Requirements**


*The Necessities*


* Former experience as an office coordinator or in a day matron or day porter role
* Lifting 35-50lbs in weight + Pushing/pulling 35-75lbs
* Standing or walking for 4-5 hours per shift
* BasicSkills in Microsoft Suite, Google Suite Products, etc.
* Liaising with various vendors
* Managing and Reviewing mail and packages
* Assisting with office meals
* Wearing Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) including Safety Glasses, gloves, and back-support as directed per OSHA/MSDS
* Potential to work additional hours as needed (Events, coverage, etc.)


*The Extras*


* Interest in Office Skills
* Event Planning
* Familiarity with Eden and Slack


The expected pay for this position is $30 an hour.

**OUR BENEFITS**



We're a growth stage startup with lots of exciting milestones ahead. We value health and wellness at Vestwell and in addition to a dedicated Employee Wellbeing Committee, we offer competitive health coverage and an open vacation policy. We have adopted a remote-hybrid office policy, but all employees are welcome at our bright, comfortable office with many workspace options in midtown Manhattan so everyone has a setting that is the most productive for them. We provide our team with all the equipment they need (plus a few perks!) to work effectively remotely. Oh, and naturally we have a great 401(k) plan!


**OUR PROCESS**  

  

It starts the same for every candidate: getting to know the team members through 1 - 2 conversations about Vestwell, your experience, and your interests. Next steps can vary by role, but the usual next steps are a skill or experience screen (e.g. a coding interview for an Engineer, a portfolio review for a Designer, deeper experience call for other roles) which leads to a virtual or in-person interview panel after that if the screens go well. *Before making an offer, our interview process concludes with a references check stage for your recruiter to meet with a current or former supervisor and peer.* We prioritize transparency and lack of surprise throughout the process.



For your awareness you will only receive correspondence from recruiting@vestwell.com any other domain not ending in Vestwell.com is not our Recruitment team.


*Vestwell's* *Privacy Policy.* *Attention California residents: In the course of conducting our business and complying with federal, state, and local government regulations governing such matters as employment, tax, insurance, etc., we must collect Personal Information from you. Should you accept employment with Vestwell you may view our California Privacy Rights Act here:* *Vestwell's California Privacy Rights Policy.*

title: General Dentist - Clifton, NJ
description:
We are currently looking to add a full-time general dentist to our established practice in Clifton, NJ! The ideal candidate will have 2+ years of clinical experience and being bi-lingual (Spanish) is preferred, but not required.



As a dentist with a growing Dr. Dental practice you are committed to providing quality dental care but you are also joining a collaborative network of dental professionals. Our vision is to create an environment of affordable, convenient, comfortable dentistry where every patients receives comprehensive care. We will aspire for every patient to become a patient for life.



As a Dr. Dental Dentist, you can expect to see a steady flow of new patients every day. Daily procedures include restoration (fillings), crown and bridge and core build-ups, extractions, dentures, root canals, oral surgery and providing comprehensive treatment plans.



As a dentist, you'll have clinical autonomy and be able to focus your entire day on providing quality patient care. You will have the support of highly skilled, trained office staff and the operational and administrative aspects of the practice will be taken care of by Dr. Dental.



Dr. Dental is currently looking for a flexible, dynamic, personable Dentist professional who can offer quality care to our patients.



What Is Offered:


* Aggressive Compensation Package
* Premium Benefits Package
* Sign On Bonuses for select locations
* Continued Educational Seminars
* High Volume offices
* Highest standard of patient care


Dentist Responsibilities Include:


* Provide dental services for patients of all ages
* Perform dental exams and provide general and emergency dental care
* Regular cleanings, scaling and prophylaxis
* Scaling and root planing (deep cleaning)
* Advise patients regarding preventative dental care and about the causes and treatment of dental problems
* Diagnose and treat oral diseases and injuries using dental instruments
* Diagnosing from x-rays
* Conduct oral cancer screenings
* Conduct amalgam and composite restorations
* Place fillings; perform pit and fissure sealants
* Socket preservations, extractions and minor oral surgeries
* Root canals, including anterior teeth, premolars and molars
* Prep and deliver crowns, bridges and veneers
* Construct full and partial dentures

title: Customs Entry Writer
description:
We are an established Custom House Broker and NVOCC that has been in business for 35 years! We offer a complete portfolio of global shipping and logistics services, including door to door freight forwarding and project management. We handle airfreight, LCL, FCL and break bulk. Regardless of cargo type or size, we have the skills and know-how to provide a choice of cost-effective solutions, around the world and around the clock.

We are an established Custom House Broker and NVOCC that has been in business for 35 years! We offer a complete portfolio of global shipping and logistics services, including door to door freight forwarding and project management. We handle airfreight, LCL, FCL and break bulk. Regardless of cargo type or size, we have the skills and know-how to provide a choice of cost-effective solutions, around the world and around the clock. We have an immediate opening for an Senior Entry Writer for our Edison, NJ office.

The Senior Customs Entry Writer is responsible for ensuring the timely and accurate preparation and submission of customs documentation for imports. This role involves coordinating with customs brokers, clients, and internal teams to ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and standards.

Key Responsibilities:  
1. Customs Documentation:  
- Prepare and review import documentation, including bills of lading, commercial invoices, and packing lists.  
- Ensure all documentation complies with customs regulations and company policies.  
- Classify goods according to the Harmonized Tariff Schedule (HTS).

2. Compliance:  
- Stay updated with changes in customs regulations and implement necessary adjustments.  
- Ensure adherence to all federal, state, and international regulations.  
- Conduct audits to verify accuracy and compliance of customs entries.

3. Coordination:  
- Coordinate with customs brokers, carriers, and other third parties to facilitate the customs clearance process.  
- Communicate with clients to obtain required documentation and provide updates on shipment status.  
- Collaborate with internal teams such as logistics, finance, and sales to ensure seamless operations.

4. Problem Resolution:  
- Address and resolve issues related to customs clearance, such as documentation discrepancies or delays.  
- Provide guidance and support to junior customs entry writers and other team members.

5. Reporting:  
- Maintain accurate records of all customs transactions and documentation.  
- Prepare regular reports on customs activities, including entry volume, compliance status, and any issues encountered.

\\*\\*Qualifications:\\*\\*  
- Bachelor’s degree in Logistics or a related field.  
- Minimum of 5 years of experience in customs brokerage or a similar role, with at least 2 years in a senior position.  
- Strong knowledge of customs regulations, import procedures, and the Harmonized Tariff Schedule (HTS).  
- Proficiency in customs software and systems.  
- Excellent communication and organizational skills.  
- Detail-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.  
- Licensed Customs Broker preferred.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 10 hour shift
* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Customs Entry Writer: 2 years (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Edison, NJ 08817 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Traveling Project Manager
description:
We are currently seeking a Project Manager to play a pivotal role in the coordination, execution, and oversight of projects in the **Northeast region (ME, VT, NH, MA, CT, NY, PA, RI, NJ)**. If you reside in one of these states and have a minimum of 5 years' experience in the restoration industry, specializing in water, flood, fire, smoke, mold, and asbestos remediation, we want to hear from you!

**A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A Construction Superintendent (Internally known as Project Manager)**


You will lead assigned projects in close collaboration with the Project Director, ensuring seamless execution from initiation to completion. Responsibilities include comprehensive project management, encompassing detailed planning, organization, and prioritization of work. Working collaboratively with the Project Director, you will not only comprehend and evaluate the Scope of Work but also execute it with precision. Your financial acumen will shine as you analyze project scopes and budgets, making decisive approvals or rejections based on actual conditions. Proactively adjusting budgets to align with the true costs of work, you'll serve as the alert system, notifying the Operations Manager of potential risks to budget, gross profit margin, or schedule. Your strategic touch extends to developing project schedules and guiding Project Supervisors in subcontractor scheduling, while also offering hands-on management, support, and assistance.


Administrative finesse will be evident in soliciting, receiving, and approving subcontractor proposals, evaluating the necessity for change orders, and meticulously preparing reports and documentation. As a liaison between Project Directors, Clients, Subcontractors, and in-house personnel, your role will be crucial in maintaining open communication channels, resolving issues promptly, and ensuring a smooth flow of information.


Your commitment to standards will not only be evident in enforcing all company, state, and federal policies, procedures, and regulations but also in your adaptability to undertake additional responsibilities or tasks as required based on priority.

**Requirements:**

* 5+ years in restoration or construction, **residing in ME, VT, NH, MA, CT, NY, PA, RI, or NJ.**
* Willingness to travel for extended periods.
* Excellent communication skills, problem-solving ability, and a commitment to excellence.
* VALID DRIVERS LICENSE REQUIRED


If you're ready for an exciting challenge and meet these requirements, we invite you to join our team. Apply now and be part of a company that values excellence and commitment to standards!

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.*

title: Spin Instructor
description:
**Benefits:**

* Sign-On Bonus
* Free Y Gym Membership
* Gym Discount for Family Members
* Sick leave
* Referral Program (earn up to $200 for each)
* All employees are eligible to participate in the 403(b) Savings Plan starting on their first day of employment. In addition, our YMCA contributes the equivalent of a certain percentage of an employee’s pay to the 401(a) Retirement Plan after meeting eligibility requirements.

**POSITION SUMMARY:**

To instruct group classes in a safe, enjoyable, and positive environment that promotes member wellness and engagement in accordance with YMCA policies and procedures. To offer a variety of exercise modalities to enhance physical fitness levels through instruction of cardiovascular, strength, flexibility and mind-body practices.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* To lead energizing, fun, safe, and educational group classes that accomplish the YMCA mission and goals.
* To answers questions from members to support them in achieving their goals related to healthy living.
* To maintain a working knowledge of health and wellness to provide effective information and support to members.
* To build effective, authentic relationships with members; help members connect with each other and the YMCA.
* To keep accurate class attendance records, if required.To follow YMCA policies and procedures, to know emergency procedures, to respond to emergency situations and to accurately file an incident report.
* To know and enforce all Fitness Center Rules to ensure the safety of all members/participants.
* To immediately stop any behavior, which in your professional opinion is deemed unsafe.
* To always act maturely and professionally.To dress neatly and professionally, with no midriff showing attire.
* To use professional music without obscene language and innuendos.To know facility schedules and familiarize oneself with all YMCA programs.
* To have the ability to adjust the workout to accommodate a variety of fitness levels.
* To educate participants on proper form, anatomy, contraindications, and modifications of a move or moves.
* To arrive on time, prepared to begin and end the class on time. On time means you are changed, organized, scan/signed in for the start of your class, available to introduce and welcome new members. 3 late arrivals will result in immediate action not limited to termination.
* To be responsible for using Group Ex Pro for own class coverage when unavailable to teach.Use Group Ex Pro for communicating class attendance.

**COMPETENCIES:**

* Mission Advancement
* Operational Effectiveness
* Personal Growth

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* **First Aid**, **CPR**, **AED**, **O2 Administration** certification required within 6-months of hire.Maintain active status every two-years.
* **Sexual Harassment** and **Child Abuse** Prevention Trainings within thirty days of hire.
* **YMCA/YUSA Foundations of Group Exercise** certification a national certification (ACE, ACSM AFAA, NASM or equivalent) in group exercise instruction. If incumbent does not have certification at time of hire, must achieve within three months of hire.
* **YMCA/YUSA Listen First** within three months of hire.Certification in areas of expertise. (Yoga, Spinning, Diabetes Prevention, etc.)
* Must have knowledge of anatomy, kinesiology, strength and conditioning program leadership and implementation.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**

* The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
* While performing the duties of this job, the employee will or may be required to: climb stairs, bend, stoop, kneel, twist, reach with hands, sit, stand for an extended period of time, lift and/or move up to 45 pounds, have finger dexterity, grasp, perform repetitive motions, talk, hear and have visual acuity.
* Plan, lead and participate in a variety of physical activities.

**HOW TO APPLY:**

Email your resume and cover letter to peter.foster@ymcali.org and eileen.knauer@ymcali.org.

**SALARY RANGE:**

Newly hired employees will be paid between $27.87 p/h and $55.00 p/h depending on experience and level of qualifications.

The YMCA of Long Island is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are an open and inclusive organization, welcoming a diverse workforce free of discrimination based on protected class status, including race, religion/creed, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, political affiliation or belief, military or veteran status, disability, predisposing genetic characteristics, marital or family status, domestic violence victim status, arrest record or criminal conviction history, or any other impermissible basis.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $27.87 - $55.00 per hour

Expected hours: 2 – 10 per week

Work Location: In person

title: Bilingual Spanish ABA Behavior Technician DSP Middlesex(S)
description:
Sunshine Advantage is hiring in various locations in Middlesex County. Locations include North Brunswick and New Brunswick.

**Position Summary:**

The Behavior Technician is a clinical team member and receives supervision per the leading BCBA. Work consists of providing 1:1 therapy with patients, assisting the BCBA in completing consultations, parent training, collaboration with other team members under the BCBA supervision regarding the assessments, data collection, creating program materials, and other assigned activities. In addition, a professional commitment to working with clients and families for an extended period is expected.

**Benefits of working at Sunshine Advantage:**

Part time flexible schedules – Employees can easily combine this part time position with a full time day job conveniently located near their preferred location

Online and on the job training

Support and assistance obtain to earn credentials to advance your career

to becoming a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)

Supervised Field experience for individuals working towards becoming a BCBA or BCaBA

Referral Bonus

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

Provide 1:1 ABA therapy to children under the clinical supervision of a BCBA or BCaBA.

Follow behavior, individualized treatment plans, and reinforcements as determined by the supervising BCBA.

Complete daily acquisition skills, maintenance, and mastered skills treatment activities.

Implement appropriate teaching strategies and behavior modification approaches stated in the treatment program.

Collect accurate data daily.

Complete billing documentation with parents' signatures.

Attends staff meetings and training as requested.

Completes additional job duties as assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities):**

High School Diploma, GED

Experience with children with special needs, developmental delays, and/or autism

Training coursework is provided for those that do not have RBT certification.

Confidentiality and discretion pertaining to the work environment and HIPAA requirements are required.

Adhere to Ethical Guidelines set forth by the BACB organization

Obtain or possess updated CPR certification and maintain re-certification every two years

Ability to develop positive working relationships with children, families, employees, and departments, maintaining collaborative professional relationships.

Professionalism and timely communication as outlined by the company.

Background Clearance is mandatory.

Excellent and positive verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

title: Mavis Tire - Tax Analyst, Tax + Treasury
description:
**Mavis Tire - Tax Analyst, Tax + Treasury**


Put your career into high gear with Mavis Discount Tire! We're looking for a full time Tax Analyst to join Team Mavis at our Corporate Offices in White Plains, NY. With over 2,000 retail locations, Mavis is one of the largest tire sales and automotive repair chains in the United States, and we're growing rapidly.


#ZR

**Position Summary and Responsibilities**

Your primary responsibilities include working with internal and external partners to ensure all sales and use tax compliance, audit, and accounting obligations are completed. Success in this role will require a passion for identifying and driving process improvements, enthusiasm for leading change, and a low tolerance for the status quo.


Apply sales and use taxation knowledge to analyze and determine the applicability of sales & use tax on business purchases and ensure correct general ledger classification for enterprise-wide purchasing activity. Manage vendor questions for resale certificates and related processes.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree required, in Accounting or Finance
* 2+ years of Sales and Use Tax experience (public or private)
* Strong organization and time management attributes with ability to handle multiple priorities
* Experience working independently in a fast-paced environment with rapidly changing priorities
* Knowledge and ability to learn of current state and local (multi-jurisdictional) sales/use tax laws, concepts, policies, and regulations and the specific application of these to retail companies
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office computer software applications; strong expertise in Excel required
* Microsoft Dynamics 365 experience a plus
* Experience and ability to respond to customers' sales tax questions (includes ability to perform tax research and provide taxability guidance)
* Ability to communicate clearly, accurately, and tactfully, both verbally and in writing, successfully translating always-complex tax rules for business partners and customers.

**Essential Functions of the Position**

* Responsible for the exemption/resale certificate process
* Collaborate with team members on providing appropriate exemptions and resale certificates to vendors and suppliers and respond to related inquiries
* Manage issuance of tax exemption certificates
* Register in new jurisdictions for sales/use tax purposes as needed
* Research and respond to sales/use tax questions submitted by internal and external customers, including responding in a timely, accurate, and complete fashion
* Provide guidance regarding taxability of products and services
* Provide support for D365 to ensure proper taxation
* Assist in audit defense efforts as needed
* Assist in reconciliation of sales/use tax workpapers including sales/use tax accounts
* Assist in the management of the monthly sales tax compliance process with outside service provider, ensuring accuracy and completeness
* Assist in the management of the indirect tax general ledger accounts and monthly tax reconciliations
* Respond to indirect tax notices and support indirect tax audits inquiries
* Assist with additional projects and assignments, including business registrations, trade name/DBA filings and annual reports, as required
* Prepare, file, and submit payment for various miscellaneous tax returns as needed
* Maintain the tax department's indirect tax filing calendar
* Maintain and update monthly process documentations as needed
* Recommend process improvement to elevate accuracy, timeliness, and efficiency
* Perform tax research using available research tools
* Contribute insights to the development of automated solutions to support our compliance process and tax-related systems
* Communicate effectively with team members and customers to provide exceptional service and support

**Employee Benefits**


At Mavis, we understand that our people drive our success. We provide our team members with competitive weekly pay, including weekly incentive compensation, a good working environment and an excellent combination of additional benefits like health, dental, vision and life insurance, a 401(k) retirement savings plan with employer match, paid vacations, paid sick and personal time, on-the-job training, and opportunities for career growth and advancement.

***Mavis is an Equal Opportunity Employer***

*Consistent with our commitment to the principal of equal employment opportunity for all individuals, we enforce a zero tolerance policy on discrimination at Mavis. Employment decisions are made without regard to an applicant's or employee's actual or perceived membership in any category or status protected by applicable federal, state or local law. The physical demands described above are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the position. Where appropriate, Mavis may provide reasonable accommodation, in order for an otherwise qualified individual to perform the essential functions of the position.*

*Mavis does not seek salary history information from applicants.*
company_description: Mavis Discount Tire is one of the largest independent automotive platforms in the United States.

title: Site Acquisition Specialist
description:
Are you looking for a fast paced position located in the Northern New Jersey area that offers a blend of working from your home office, and field locations? Are you ready to pursue a career with a company that fosters collaboration, professional growth, and a commitment to excellence? **Apply today!**

Airosmith Development are looking for experienced **Site Acquisition Specialist** professionals who have worked on wireless site development projects and/or a motivated individual with strong desire to learn a new trade. This position is responsible for Site Acquisition duties related to wireless and/or utility projects within various geographic footprints or regions. Site Acquisition duties primarily include site identification, leasing, zoning and permitting.

The ideal candidate is a self-starter who operates with integrity and hustle. A strong communicator who thinks ahead and commits to the success of the project and team. An individual that demonstrates our **Core Values**:

* Be a Self-starter.
* Always Think Ahead.
* Unwavering Commitment.
* Operate with Integrity.
* Consistently and Effectively Communicate.

**Site Acquisition Specialist I (entry-level)**

**Responsibilities,** *include but are not limited to the following:*

* Investigates geographic areas to determine the feasibility of site candidates while balancing land use compatibility factors.
* For existing sites/modifications/upgrades, perform file audits to determine existing conditions, client entitlements and course of action for proposed scope of work.
* Research relevant state and local land use and zoning laws and prepare summaries as needed.
* Identifies potential landlords, confirm interest, initial offer(s) and conduct supervised preliminary leasing discussions regarding general lease terms under supervision of direct supervisor /manager.
* Coordinates preparation of title reports, environmental assessments, and any/all other due diligence items necessary for completing real estate transactions.
* Coordinates construction, engineering, legal and other departments as necessary to complete the land use entitlement process.
* To gain experience by observing, attend community meetings and municipal zoning hearings.
* Under the supervision of direct supervisor/manager assists with local municipalities and any other applicable agencies, taking all steps required to obtain the necessary building permits.
* Files all necessary paperwork with county clerk’s office to ensure proper recording of the real estate transaction.
* Assists with ongoing forecasting of dates/completion relating to assigned projects
* Ensures all records are kept properly.
* Provides weekly status reports.

**Site Acquisition Specialist II (mid-level)**

**Responsibilities,** *include the above and below, but are not limited to the following:*

* Responsible for site candidate identification, due diligence, and lease negotiations within a specified search area.
* Attend all public hearings and community meetings as related to assigned projects.
* Work with local municipalities and any other applicable agencies, taking all steps required to obtain the necessary building permits.
* Assist Project Manager as needed with respect to project related tasks.
* Close interaction and coordination with engineering, zoning, and construction teams.
* Oversee all related aspects for assigned projects including site identification; reviewing the zoning feasibility; negotiating price, term, escalation, equipment location, securing property rights; conducting high quality constructability review; preparing site sketch; reviewing title report for ownership, encumbrances, easements, etc.; obtaining landlord sign-off on all drawings prior to submittal for compliance with public agency.
* Prepare and submit candidate packages for client review and pre-zoning analysis for approved candidates.
* Regular reporting of project status and schedule.
* Updates Airosmith and/or client databases, such as, Airoflow, Site Tracker, Pace, Norad, Fuze, etc.

**Sr. Site Acquisition Specialist (senior-level)**

**Responsibilities,** *include the above and below, but are not limited to the following:*

* Overall supervisory responsibility of all projects assigned.
* Manages site leasing and acquisition agreements for the installation of telecommunications / utility (necessary) infrastructure at multiple sites.
* Reports the status of projects to Project Manager, clients, subcontractors, and other involved parties.
* Coordinates and monitors permit applications, regulatory reports, and construction plans for sites.
* Oversees sites to ensure projects stay on schedule and ensure all records are kept properly.
* Investigate geographic areas to determine the feasibility of site candidates while balancing land use compatibility factors.
* For existing sites/modifications/upgrades, perform file audits to determine existing conditions, client entitlements and course of action for proposed scope of work.
* Research relevant state and local land use and zoning laws and prepare summaries as needed.
* Identify potential landlords, confirm interest, initial offer(s) and conduct supervised preliminary leasing discussions regarding general lease terms under supervision of direct supervisor/manager.
* Coordinate preparation of title reports, environmental assessments and any/all other due diligence items necessary for completing real estate transactions.
* Coordinate construction, engineering, legal and other departments as necessary to complete the land use entitlement process.
* Responsible for site candidate identification, due diligence, and lease negotiations within a specified search area.
* Attend all public hearings and community meetings as related to assigned projects.
* Work with local municipalities and any other applicable agencies, taking all steps required to obtain the necessary building permits.
* File all necessary paperwork with county clerk’s office to ensure proper recording of the real estate transaction.
* Assist with ongoing forecasting of dates/completion relating to assigned projects.
* Assist Project Manager as needed with respect to project related tasks.
* Close interaction and coordination with engineering, zoning, and construction teams.
* Oversee all related aspects for assigned projects including site identification; reviewing the zoning feasibility; negotiating price, term, escalation, equipment location, securing property rights; conducting high quality constructability review; preparing site sketch; reviewing title report for ownership, encumbrances, easements, etc.; obtaining landlord sign-off on all drawings prior to submittal for compliance with public agency.
* Prepare and submits candidate packages for client review and pre-zoning analysis for approved candidates.
* Regular reporting of project status and schedule.
* Provides weekly status reports.
* Updates Airosmith and/or client databases, such as, ST, Pace, Norad, Fuze, etc.

**Requirements:**

* **Must be located in the Northern New Jeresy area.**
* **A valid state driver's license.**
* **Specialist I (entry-level): 1-2 years’** site acquisition, real estate, development, and/or telecommunications experience preferred.
* **Specialist II (mid-level): 3-5 years'** prior telecommunications site acquisition experience and some form of project management experience required.
* **Sr. Specialist (senior-level): 6-8 years'** prior telecommunications site acquisition experience and some form of project management experience required.

**Education:**

* **Bachelor’s degree required.**

*Airosmith, Inc. dba Airosmith Development is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran, citizenship or immigration status or other characteristics protected by law.*

**Who We Are:**

Founded in 2004, Airosmith Development is a women-owned and operated, turnkey development company that provides wireless infrastructure site development services nationwide to commercial wireless carriers, utility companies, the military and government entities seeking to expand, upgrade and/or maintain their wireless networks. We are highly specialized in site acquisition services, project management and technical construction services.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Site Acquisition: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Electronic Test Technician (Entry Level)
description:
**Retlif Testing Laboratories** is looking to hire a **full-time Entry Level Electronic Test Technician (willing to train)** to join our Ronkonkoma, New York laboratory. Do you have a background with an interest in and exposure to basic electronics and electrical fundamentals and want a **career, not just a job**? This position earns **competitive pay**, depending on experience. We also offer **excellent benefits**, including **medical, dental, vision, a 401(k) plan, paid holidays, paid time off (PTO), and a tuition reimbursement program**. If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, consider applying today!

**ABOUT RETLIF TESTING LABORATORIES**


An industry leader for over 40 years, we are an independent testing laboratory that provides compliance testing and engineering services to customers in such industries as aerospace, rail, maritime, military, defense, and medical. Retlif provides electromagnetic compatibility, radio approval, product safety, and environmental simulation testing to national and international standards. We pride ourselves on providing exceptional customer service. We have a loyal and long-standing customer base that appreciates our commitment to the highest quality in testing and engineering services. Our mission is to fully address the testing and compliance needs of our clients.


As a team member at one of the USA's leading independent testing laboratories, you can expect **excellent personal growth opportunities**, a **professional atmosphere**, and **comprehensive employee benefits**. We are an **equal opportunity employer** that **values each member of our team**.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Test sample preparation and setup.
* Execution of tests following detailed procedures utilizing various electronic and RF test equipment.
* Clear and concise documentation of test results.
* Strict adherence to quality policies and procedures.
* Customer interaction.

**QUALIFICATIONS FOR AN ELECTRONIC TEST TECHNICIAN**

* Minimum High School diploma. Trade School Certificate, or equivalent formal military training/work a plus.
* Must have a background that would permit the U.S. Department of Defense to issue a Secret Clearance, which includes U.S. Citizenship.
* Strong math/logic skills.
* Ability to lift 50 pounds-bend, lift and twist.
* Proficient in MS Word and Excel.
* Knowledge of basic electrical fundamentals a plus (OHMs Law, AC wiring, etc.)
* Prior experience with electronics measurement equipment a plus (specifically DMM, Oscilloscope, and Spectrum Analyzer).


Are you organized and attentive to detail? Do you have excellent interpersonal skills? Can you effectively follow instructions with multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment with an organized approach? Do you have strong communication skills? Are you self-motivated with a strong work ethic? If so, you might just be perfect for this position!

**WORK SCHEDULE**


This full-time Electronic Test Technician job is **Monday - Friday, 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM**. Overtime may be necessary at times, depending on customer needs.

**READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?**


We understand your time is valuable, and that is why we have a very quick and easy application process. If you feel that you would be right for this job, please fill out our initial **3-minute, mobile-friendly application**. We look forward to meeting you!

title: Youth Workers for After School Program 2024-2025
description:

title: Digital Media Specialist
company: Beyond Media Global LLC - New Jersey
description:
**About us**

Beyond Media Global LLC - New Jersey is a Digital Agency based in Paramus NJ. Our goal is to craft user centric experiences from Wix sites to Paid Media Campaigns to Dynamic Original Content. With our Idea Driven Performance Methodology, combined with cutting-edge integrated technology, we identify growth head-on with precision. Whether it's crafting multi-platform activations to captivating audiences on Connected TV to creating thought-driven masterpieces that resonate hearts and minds, we’re all about laying the smack down to any challenge.

Job Highlights

* Work with Top Tier Clients
* Ad Platforms: Amazon, Google, Meta, Apple
* Analytics: Adobe and Google.
* Fun, Young Environment
* Paramus NJ

Key Responsibilities:

* Setup and execution of performance campaigns across Amazon SEM, Social and Display/Programmatic
* On-going optimization to achieve client’s KPI target
* Effectively manage campaign budget spend by implementing relevant bidding strategies and keeping track of budget pacing, updating the strategy, and troubleshoot accordingly
* Proactively identity initiatives and opportunities for your market, aligned against local market KPIs
* Lead the coordination, preparation, and execute multi-channel strategies
* Produce and develop reports on monthly campaign performance, audiences, creative analysis, and cross channel attribution - update client performance reports, analyze and format data, supply insights and commentary
* Be at the forefront overall Performance Marketing knowledge by keeping up to date with industry news and developments
* Have an understanding of the various digital media channels (Amazon, SEM, Display, Programmatic, Social Media) and the potential for them in your clients marketing activity
* Work with our Account Leads to ensure that:
* campaigns / projects timelines, cost estimates, schedules and forecasts are accurately developed and adhered to
* campaigns are set up and optimized in the correct way, according to brief and best practices.
* budgets are spent within daily / monthly limits and invoices are correctly reconciled at the end of each month
* campaigns are monitored regularly and hit relevant targets
* reports and presentations are delivered to the highest level of quality and integrity

Requirements:

* 3-4 years relevant, hands-on campaign management experience (SEM, Social & Display/Programmatic)
* Expertise on Google Ads, Facebook Ad Manager and Amazon Ads
* Familiar with Google Marketing Platforms (e.g. SA360, DV360, Campaign Manager)
* Digital media planning and buying with relevant qualification from Google, Meta and Amazon Ads
* Excellent knowledge and passion for digital and strong technical skills
* Strong client-facing skills: understanding client needs, maintaining relationships, building partnerships
* Communicates effectively at all levels, both up and down
* Demonstrates honesty and integrity, Analytical and strategic mindset
* Strong numerical skills and attention to detail
* Able to work in under pressure environment and resolve client issues
* Flexible to work collaboratively across teams
* Candidate with more experience shall be considered for Senior Digital Performance Media Specialist
* US Citizenship Required

What We Offer

* Fun & Young Team with an Awesome Food Court
* Office Located in Paramus
* Well Stocked Pantry with Healthy Options and Snacks
* Team Building
* 5 day work
* Performance bonus
* Private Medical Insurance
* Opportunity to learn new techniques & tools
* A Part of a Global Agency for Global Exposure to Clients

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

title: Shop at Home Sales Associate
description:
**Ring's End, Inc.** is calling all customer service professionals who are interested in a **full-time Shop at Home Sales Associate** job in the **Fairfield County, CT** area to apply to join our amazing design team!

**WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN OUR TEAM**


We are an **established company** in the building material industry **that invests in our team and offers real** opportunities for career growth. We pay this full-time position **competitive pay**. Our team also enjoys great benefits, including **traditional and Roth 401K, 3% 401K safe harbor company contribution, various medical insurance plans, FSA & DCA, employee discounts on our products and materials, life/accidental death & dismemberment insurance, long & short-term disability, paid holidays, paid time off (PTO), employee assistance program, and a legal counseling program.** We also make it easy to apply with our initial quick and easy mobile-optimized application. If we have your attention, please continue reading!

 **ABOUT RING'S END INC**


We are a Connecticut-based lumber and building materials retailer serving Connecticut, South County, Rhode Island, and Westchester County, New York. We are a third-generation, family-run company with a rich history dating back to 1902. Guided by a tradition of service and a commitment to innovation, we are dedicated to becoming the premier resource in the building material industry for builders and remodelers, painting contractors, architects, and homeowners.


Our growth and success are due to our team of professionals. We employ the best team in the industry, ensuring we maintain a **diverse** and **evolving** work environment that values **cooperation and teamwork**. We look for innovation and continuous improvement in everything we do. We're looking for more to join us!

 **ARE YOU A GOOD FIT?**

**We are looking for someone who has excellent communication and customer service skills and can guide clients with their inquiries with confidence.** Ask yourself: Do you enjoy interacting with people and helping them? Are you organized and detail-oriented? Can you manage your time well and prioritize multiple tasks effectively? If so, please consider applying for this position today!

 **Responsibilities**

* Quotes-Window Treatments, Wallpaper, Rugs and Fabric.
* Special orders- ordering product, invoicing and vendor invoicing
* Tracking product
* Overseeing installation
* Problem solving in the field
* Seeking out job sites
* Building relationships with builders and architects
* Working closely with all Ring's End outside reps to build connections.
* Quote all window quotes that are going out.
	+ All window packages will be getting window treatments quotes along with it.
	+ Inside and outside sales associates will send window dimensions and designers are responsible for turning the window treatment quotes around within 24 hours back to sales associates.
* Stay current on design trends.
* Stay organized, turn quotes around 24hours.
* Design & Décor "experts" on product and problem solving
	+ Being able to come up with products to work in difficult situations and finding solutions to satisfy customer needs.
* Call on stores that do not have a designer and do in-store appointments for color as well.

 **Apply today!**

title: Production Administrator
description:
We are looking for a responsible, motivated, detail-oriented, and highly-organized Production Administrator of "many hats" to work alongside and support a busy and high-energy on-air talent and media entrepreneur with two production companies. Resourcefulness, discretion, common sense, and a “can-do” attitude are key. This position is ideal for someone who is familiar with the video and television production industry and that can work independently.

Responsibilities:

* Inbox management for multiple email accounts that will include email drafting for professional email responses.
* Maintain multiple calendars
* Manage day-to-day operation of all social media accounts that include but are not limited to: developing a monthly strategy, creating a content calendar for scheduling approved posts, responding to comments/messages, engagement and response management.
* Scheduling meetings, attend client-facing meetings and send notes/ action items for each meeting
* Booking videographers, photographers, Hair/Makeup Artists (contacts provided) for video shoots
* Manage asset delivery to clients
* Invoicing via Quickbooks
* Manage payroll via PrimePoint
* Book guests and write scripts in support of a local television show
* Organization (maintaining spreadsheets, Google Drive, DropBox)
* Crafting and revising presentation decks
* An important aspect of this role is for this person to be an advocate for the primary’s creative endeavors, including an understanding and love for New Jersey, and believe in the work. They would need to be able to think on their feet and shift gears frequently with a can-do attitude.

Skills:

* Organization
* Business, accounting, or bookkeeping experience a plus
* Can do attitude a must!
* Google Drive
* Outlook email
* Ability to multitask and work on several projects at once
* Familiar with video editing
* Comfortable communicating directly with clients

Qualifications:

* High school diploma or equivalent required; associate's or bachelor's degree preferred
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Attention to detail and accuracy in work

This is a great opportunity for someone who is detail-oriented, organized, and enjoys providing administrative support, with a chance to be creative. If you meet the qualifications and are interested in this position, please submit your resume for consideration.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $25.00 per hour

title: Operations Manager
description:
**Who We Are…**



Since our founding in 1901, Limbach’s primary core value has always been: **We Care**.


**We Care** about you as a person: your safety, career, development, and the local community.


**We Care** to impact diversity in construction to create a collaborative work environment focused on generating a sense of belonging and accomplishment.



Limbach Company LLC, a subsidiary of Limbach Holdings, Inc., (NASDAQ: LMB) is an integrated building systems solutions firm whose expertise is the design, installation, management, service, and maintenance of HVAC, mechanical, electrical, plumbing and control systems.



We engineer, construct, and service the mechanical, plumbing, air conditioning, heating, building automation, electrical and control systems in both new and existing buildings and infrastructure. We work for building owners in the private, not-for-profit, and public/government sectors.


***Our vision*** is to create value for building owners targeting opportunities for long term relationships.


***Our purpose*** is to create great opportunities for people.



We carry out our vision and purpose through a commitment to our four core values…


* We Care
* We Act with Integrity
* We Are Innovative
* We Are Accountable

  


**The Benefits & Perks…**


* Base Salary Range: $180,000 - $200,000
* Full portfolio of medical, dental, and vision benefits, along with 401K plan and company match.
* HSA, FSA, and life insurance offerings.
* Maximize your professional development with our award-winning Learning & Engagement team.
* Engage in our “We Care” culture through our ERGs, brought to you by EMBRACE.
* Career pathing flexibility and mobility.

  




**Who You Are…**



As Operations Manager, you will assume responsibility for ensuring and improving the performance, productivity, efficiency, and profitability of the Company through the provision of effective methods and strategies. This role is tasked with delivering and assisting with selling of projects over $500K in size. The Operations Manager understands how to successfully deliver design build infrastructure projects directly to building owners, including management of subcontractors, effective communication with the building owner representative and maximizing gross profit returns. It is expected that this position works very closely with the VP of Sales and their staff to help identify and sell MEP infrastructure projects from the branch’s top 5 accounts.

  


**This Position…**



Is under the direct supervision of the Branch Manager, and is counted on to enhance and maintain the performance, productivity, efficiency and profitability of the Company.



Some examples of the work you might do includes:


* Responsible for delivering an exceptional customer experience, rooted in on-time delivery, superior quality and delivery.
* Advocates and reinforces the guiding principles, wellness program, and safety culture of the Company.
* **Manager & Cross Function Collaborator** - S/he creates an environment where the ODR team and sales staff work together closely, while maintaining clear roles and responsibilities across the cross-functional team, following our guardrails about what each position is responsible for. The person should be focused on providing a seamless customer experience, comfortable collaborating with the account teams regardless of, whether or not they report directly to them, reporting relationship, because their goal is to ensure the customer has a seamless experience. They enjoy being on-site with their teams, consistently meeting with customers. S/he demonstrates the ability to inspire and motivate a team with tremendous positive energy.
* **Attractor and developer of talent -** Ability to be present locally and recruit talent - S/he understands how to source talent from the local marketplace and is consistently identifying current and future potential talent, recruiting and searching for talent regardless of the need at the time. S/he is an ambassador of the brand and company, creating a pool of interested talent. They create an environment alongside the Branch Manager, General Manager & VP of Sales where prospective employees are asking to join the Company. They are actively focused on the development of their team, both in the current role and future career path.
* **Financial & Reporting Expectations** - S/he is proficient at managing and projecting costs in projects. S/he understands how to maximize the cash position in an owner direct project model. S/he actively monitors projects on a weekly and monthly basis.
* **Proactive Approach** - The Operations Manager knows how to manage and build a relationship with a building owner.S/he balances the relationship needs with managing the PCO process, ensuring we remain cash positive, maximizing overall return and improving gross profit from booking to closeout.
* **Resource Management** -S/he is are able to properly manage a diverse set of resources over both the short and long term, actively engaging both the field and office teams.
* **Strategic Alignment** - Supports both the VP of Sales and Branch Manager executing the Company’s strategy locally. local strategy. S/he participates in the creation of the localized strategy and has a primary responsibility in executing it.
* **Hands-On Experience** - The Operations Manager understands how to manage projects and is willing to help their teams in any manner necessary. S/he is responsible for ensuring projects execute on track and if one is off track, immediately remediating the causes of delay, including spending time with the team on-site and employing an operating rhythm to resolve issues.
* Drives onsite teams to manage projects according to agreed upon contract terms without variances.

  


**What You Need…**


* Bachelor’s Degree (in a construction-related field) or equivalent.
* 10+ years of experience within the mechanical HVAC industry.
* 5+ years of project management experience.
* Demonstrated ability to engage in effective collaboration and communication (both written and verbal).
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Demonstrated experience leading a team.
* Prior customer facing experience.
* Strong cross-functional collaboration skills.


**Conduct Standards:**


* Maintains appropriate Company confidentiality at all times.
* Protects the assets of the Company and ethically upholds the Code of Conduct & Ethics in all situations.
* Cultivates and promotes the “Hearts & Minds” safety culture.
* Consistently exemplifies the Core Values of the Company (we CARE, we act with INTEGRITY, we are INNOVATIVE, and we are ACCOUNTABLE).


**Work Environment:**


* This position operates in a professional office environment, and routinely utilizes standard office equipment, such as computers, phones, copiers, and filing cabinets.


**Physical Demands:**


* In performing the duties of this job, the incumbent is regularly required to talk, hear, perform repetitive motion, and possess an appropriate degree of both visual acuity and manual dexterity.
* This is considered a light work position, which means possible exertion of up to twenty (20) pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to ten (10) pounds of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects.

  


***This job description is intended to describe the general nature of work being performed by the individual who assumes this role, not an exhaustive list of responsibilities. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time, with or without notice, as business needs dictate. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position. Limbach Facility Services LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.***

  

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Staff Data Scientist
description:
As a Data Scientist at IAS, you will be part of a team that is a center of innovation for the company and a major contributor to the company's core products. You'll tackle complex challenges that impact the entire Data Science function, with a particular focus on enhancing ad performance and optimization through advanced machine learning techniques.



The ideal candidate has a track record of delivering deep learning-based models at scale, enjoys working with cross-functional commercial and technical partners to deliver solutions within a timeline, and brings innovative solutions to complex problems with a desire to improve the status quo.



What you'll get to do:


* Scope and Develop ML Projects: Lead the identification and execution of machine learning projects
* Data Integration and Model Development: Integrate diverse data sources to build and deploy production-ready ML models and recommendation systems that enhance ad targeting, placement, and performance.
* Innovative Solutions: Apply machine learning to novel problems in programmatic advertising, pushing the boundaries of what's possible.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with engineers and commercial teams to seamlessly integrate ML solutions into broader engineering workflows, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
* Leadership in Model Development: Spearhead the development of proprietary AI models tailored for programmatic ad optimization, directly contributing to revenue-generating products.
* Stakeholder Communication: Effectively communicate insights from ML models to various stakeholders, including R&D, product teams, and commercial partners, ensuring that technical results translate into actionable business strategies.
* Domain Expertise: Establish yourself as a domain expert in programmatic advertising, leading research initiatives and overseeing the end-to-end delivery of client-facing products.

What you'll need:


* Advanced degree (MSc, PhD preferred) in a relevant technical field (machine learning, computer science, statistics, mathematics etc)
* 8+ years of industry experience, with technical leadership, and experience guiding ML projects from start to finish
* Experience with at least one scripting language such as Python
* Familiarity with relational databases and SQL
* Experience with source control workflows and deploying ML models in production
* Comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources
* Experience distilling product requirements into problem definitions, dealing with ambiguity and competing objectives
* Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner
* Deep curiosity and a love of problem solving

What puts you over the top:


* Practical experience with programmatic advertising and the bid stream
* Experience in building recommendation systems
* Experience working with distributed computing tools (Hadoop, Spark, Hive, etc.) and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP)

  




*New York Applicants: The salary range for this position is $135,100 - $231,600. Actual pay may vary based on experience or geographic location.*


**About Integral Ad Science**



Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a leading global media measurement and optimization platform that delivers the industry's most actionable data to drive superior results for the world's largest advertisers, publishers, and media platforms. IAS's software provides comprehensive and enriched data that ensures ads are seen by real people in safe and suitable environments, while improving return on ad spend for advertisers and yield for publishers. Our mission is to be the global benchmark for trust and transparency in digital media quality. For more information, visit integralads.com.



**Equal Opportunity Employer:**


*IAS is an equal opportunity employer, committed to our diversity and inclusiveness. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or age. We strongly encourage women, people of color, members of the LGBTQIA community, people with disabilities and veterans to apply.*


**California Applicant Pre-Collection Notice:**


*We collect personal information (PI) from you in connection with your application for employment or engagement with IAS, including the following categories of PI: identifiers, personal records, commercial information, professional or employment or engagement information, non-public education records, and inferences drawn from your PI. We collect your PI for our purposes, including performing services and operations related to your potential employment or engagement. For additional details or if you have questions, contact us at compliance@integralads.com.*


**To learn more about us, please visit** **http://integralads.com/**


*Attention agency/3rd party recruiters: IAS does not accept any unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles. If you are interested in becoming an IAS recruiting partner, please send an email introducing your company to recruitingagencies@integralads.com. We will get back to you if there's interest in a partnership.*

title: Groundskeeping Supervisor
description:
**Groundskeeping Supervisor**

**Shift available: 6am-2:30pm**

National Management Resources has provided facilities management services for over 40 years. We work in educational settings, including K-12 facilities, boarding schools, colleges, and universities all over the country. Competitive wages.

We are looking for a Groundskeeping Supervisor to perform general grounds maintenance and landscaping activities while supervising staff in the landscaping and maintenance of campus grounds to provide an aesthetically pleasing and functional outdoor environment.

**Groundskeeping Supervisor Benefits:** 

* Year-round work
* Work independently throughout the day
* Paid time off
* Paid holidays
* Health, dental & vision insurance
* 401K
* Short-term disability
* Weekend work available

**Groundskeeping Supervisor Responsibilities:** 

· Direct the groundskeeping staff in daily maintenance of campus properties.

· Supervise and train assigned employees and student workers; conduct staff meetings to share department strategy, goals, and other information; train staff on usage of equipment, proper landscaping techniques, and proper safety techniques.

· Manage the physical resources of the grounds department, determine equipment needed.

· Perform, monitor, and manage tasks such as irrigation, tree removal, trimming, plumbing, parking lot maintenance, and consult with contractors to determine extent of service required and schedule work to have minimal impact on daily operations of facilities.

· Select, purchase, and monitor application of chemical fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides.

· Consult with Director, grounds maintenance professionals and other staff to assess campus grounds maintenance needs.

* Mow, trim, and edge lawns, including sports fields.
* Use blower to clean landscaped and parking lot areas.
* Remove snow with shovels, blowers, and plows.
* Keep grounds clean and free of trash and debris.
* Prune, plant, weed, and fertilize trees, shrubs, flowers, and lawns.
* Maintain grounds equipment.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Groundskeeping Supervisor Qualifications:**

* Have a valid driver's license
* Lift up to 50 pounds
* Work from ladders
* Climb stairs

title: Human Resources Business Partner, Retail (Central Region)
description:
About Us
David Yurman is a celebrated American jewelry company founded in New York by David Yurman, a sculptor, and his wife, Sybil, a painter and ceramicist. When the artists began collaborating, their goal was simply to make beautiful objects to wear. Led today by their son Evan, David Yurman creates timeless, yet contemporary collections for women and men defined by inspiration, innovation, consummate craftsmanship and cable – the brand’s artistic signature. David Yurman collections are available at 50 retail stores throughout the United States, Canada, Hong Kong and France and at over 300 locations worldwide, through their exclusive authorized fine jewelry and timepiece network of retailers.
Our Values
At David Yurman, creativity, innovation and impeccable craftsmanship are at the core of everything we do. Fueled by the energy of our hometown, New York City, artistic passion informs each and every jewelry design. The Yurman family’s guiding vision continually defines and redefines what it means to be the preeminent American luxury jewelry brand. We are committed to responsible business and social practices and to the protection and advancement of human rights. We believe in partnering with others who share these values and understand their importance.
Job Description
This role is the designated Human Resources Business Partner (HRBP) for the retail population of the Central region. As part of the Retail HRBP team, you will be responsible for planning and implementing People & Culture related policies, programs, and practices that produce a high-performance culture and ensure the Company’s goals for the Retail Division are met. You will support talent development, mitigate employee relations issues, enhance employee experience and support recruitment as the point-of-contact for all HR matters in your region.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:* Employee Relations
	+ Work proactively with Retail management to minimize employee relations issues.
	+ When needed, conduct investigations or interventions to mitigate/resolve problems.
	+ Approve and administer disciplinary actions.
	+ Partner with senior management and legal on cases – recommend action plans.
	+ Ensure adherence with all HR policies, as well as employment-related legal, regulatory and compliance requirements.
* Talent Development
	+ Lead Annual Review process for region – manage consistency and completion.
	+ Partner with managers throughout year to monitor and improve employee performance.
	+ Support promotions, career path mapping and succession planning.
	+ Work with Learning & Development to assess needs (new hires, people managers, ongoing development), shape content and champion platforms with teams.
* Recruitment & Exits
	+ Source, interview and assess retail talent.
	+ Specific focus on pipelining for staffing new stores.
	+ Coach managers on hiring best practices.
	+ Conduct exit interviews and log/analyze/report on meaningful feedback and retention/turnover data.
	+ Support onboarding and off boarding operations with payroll/benefits, IT, L&D, LP, etc.
* People Operations
	+ Work with Compensation team on ensuring competitive package offerings per location and Benefits team to publicize and market robust offerings to staff.
	+ Work with Finance team and Retail Operations on headcount planning per store.
	+ Keep HRIS system up-to-date, help users as needed.
	+ Ensure parity in policies, practices and standards.
	+ Identify and implement programming to optimize the retail employee experience.


Qualifications:* Bachelor’s degree and 5+ years of hands-on HR experience, preferably independently managing a population.
* Knowledge of fundamental HR practices – employee relations, talent development, performance management, recruitment, compensation + benefits, employment law.
* Familiar with HR systems – Workday, LinkedIn Recruiter, digital learning platforms.
* Excellent communication + presentation skills.
* Willing to travel.


Location: Central Region, USA
Estimate Salary Range: $120,000 - $140,000
Base pay is one component of David Yurman’s total compensation package, which may also include the following for eligible employees: access to healthcare benefits, 401(k) plan, bonus, employee discounts, Summer Fridays (corporate roles), generous paid time off, sick time, and more.
Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at David Yurman
As a company founded by artists, David Yurman champions self-expression in everything we do. We are committed to fostering a culture of openness and creative collaboration within our entire community, and we cherish the diversity of our employees’ backgrounds and perspectives. We will always advocate for equity and inclusion for all.
David Yurman is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and provides equal opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to an individual’s age, race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender).
company_description: At David Yurman, our values are based on communication, collaboration, inclusion, care, collaboration and creativity. DY is proud to hire employees diverse talent who embraces these core values,

title: Special Situations Apprentice
description:
**Prosek Partners: Special Situations Apprentice Program**



At Prosek Partners, the stories we tell impact the global economy.



Prosek's Special Situations Apprentice Program offers post graduate students the opportunity to launch their careers in financial communications. Our 6-month program is designed to train the next generation of PR agency professionals.



In this program, you'll get the chance to work in a fast-paced environment alongside some of the biggest household financial services names in the world and play a critical role on the Special Situations team. You are expected to have the ability to juggle multiple projects in an exciting and fast-paced environment.



Our special situations team guides companies through pivotal milestones and events in their evolutions, from transformative M&A to reputation-defining crises. We help companies "nail the narrative" and secure lasting buy-in with the audiences that matter most.

  


**Program Overview and Responsibilities**


*Real Work Experience*



Prosek Apprentices will do tasks such as:



Daily Administrative


* Do daily monitoring and analysis of key trends and activity impacting current and potential transaction activity
* Provide ongoing updates and customization of pitch decks
* League table tracking and submission
* Project management, tracking and reporting
* Learn to monitor SEC and legal filings


Media Relations


* Secure relevant media opportunities on behalf of clients, including embargoed media exclusives around strategic announcements
* Assist Prosek team with client media prep sessions
* Develop a keen understanding and knowledge of the media landscape
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with reporters who cover your clients' transactions/announcements


Writing


* Deliver first drafts of external and internal client communications, including but not limited to: press releases, messaging, memos, fight letters, FAQ/Q&A, fact sheets, investor presentations, talking points, management scripts, media briefing materials, and related transaction documents, etc.

  


*Professional Development and Training*



Prosek's Boot Camp program is a curriculum curated and taught by top leaders across the firm on a weekly basis throughout the program. Our Boot Camps are designed to educate Apprentices on both PR and our client sectors. Topics of education include:


* Capital Markets and Asset Management
* Professional Services and Financial Technology
* Media Training and Reporter Relationship Building
* Crisis Communications and Special Situations
* Wealth Management and Banking
* Client Readiness

  


*Internal Network and Support*



We invest heavily into the growth and support for our Prosek Apprentices, pairing each Apprentice with a manager, a media buddy and a mentor.


* Managers are responsible for identifying their Apprentice's strengths, areas for development, and interests to ensure they're given the right tools to succeed.
* Media mentors help Apprentices navigate the financial media landscape and develop their media relations skills.
* Mentors provide support to Apprentices as they acclimate to a new environment and corporate culture.

  



The goal of Prosek's Special Situations Apprentice Program is to develop Apprentices into Assistant Account Executives by the end of the program.

  


**Experience and Qualifications**


* Completed BS/BA degree by the start of the program.
* Strong interest in financial services, professional services, technology, and B2B communications.
* Strong interest in "special situations work" including mergers & acquisitions, shareholder activism, crisis and litigation support, and more.
* Strong analytical, research, written, and verbal skills.
* Possess a team player mindset and willingness to work collaboratively.
* Adaptable and able to work in a fast-paced culture
* Have solid research and critical thinking skills along with strong time management and prioritization skills.
* Extreme attention to detail is a must.
* Strongly encouraged (but not required) to have prior PR internship(s).

  



The anticipated pay rate for this position is $20/hour.

  


**Our Beliefs on Culture, Diversity & Belonging:**



We are committed to building a diverse workforce reflecting and embracing diversity of all kinds - race, ethnicity, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, political affiliation, socioeconomic backgrounds. We believe having teams that represent the broader communities where we live and work creates a culture that celebrates creativity, inclusiveness and teamwork and helps us offer our global clientele of mature and emerging businesses counsel that is dynamic, rich and nuanced.

  



Prosek Partners provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

  


*#LI-HYBRID*
